She stocks up on vegetables (carrots, eggplants, cabbages, turnips, onions) in Potou and Louga to resell in the Ouarack Market. With her loan, Tacko counts on buying two bags of manioc and two bags of sweet potatoes to maximize her profits. The anticipated profits will be used to buy a sheep to fatten. She participates a little bit in the family's spending, which is handled by her husband.

loans.use: ACHAT DE LEGUMES

loans.name: Milalyn

texts.en:
Milalyn is 24 years old and married. She is from Prenza, Tangub City. Milalyn has two grown children who have helped her in taking care of the bananas. They have been raising bananas for five years and earn 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2011, Milalyn joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be humble. 

Judy operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her grocery store business. She will use the KES15,000 loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to manage her financial needs. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is married with 5 children. Bernadette is 25 years old and resides in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Bernadette raises pigs for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase feed. Bernadette joined GDMPC last 2011. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old, married and has two children. She makes and sells baskets made of sisal, beads and old bottle tops. She also sells African design fabric in the same business premise. Besides that, she does farming for more income generation.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Grace has learned how to save her money because she has been trained on financial management. She has requested a loan of 90,000 KES to buy raw materials such as beads and sisal for making baskets. Grace hopes to have a permanent business premise in the future.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as beads and sisal

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupea été créé le 30 décembre 2012.IL est composé de 23 femmes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, par voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce et l’élevage. Marame(debout à droite sur la photo) est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 20 ans. Elle a en charge 01 fille. Elle a comme activité principale l'élevage. Elle compte acheter 08 moutons pour embouche et des poulets. Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 30, 2012 and is comprised of 23 women who come from the same village. They came together based on affinity and proximity. Their main business is livestock farming. 

Marame (in the front row and at right in the photo) is in charge of the group. She is 20 years old and has one daughter. Her main occupation is livestock farming. She would like to buy chickens as well as eight sheep that she can fatten up. Her goal is to meet the needs of her family and to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep and chickens.

loans.name: A Trabajar Group

texts.es: ¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el grupo A Trabajar. Paulina, presidenta del grupo, es casada y tiene 1 hijo pero esta en el extranjero, vive con su esposo, con su nuera y sus 3 nietas. Paulina se dedica a la venta pulpa de cangrejo, ya que trabaja con su esposo. Comenzó hace 20 años ya que su esposo era taxista, no le alcanzaba para los gastos de la casa y por un amigo conoció el negocio. Cuenta con varios clientes en restaurantes y mercados, ya que los vende por mayor. Con el Préstamo va a comprar más cangrejos, ya que quiere mejorar sus ingresos, además tiene varios pedidos que ahora va a poder realizar. El sueño de Paulina es poder crecer ya que tiene planes de ahorrar para poder tener un restaurante. Paulina es la señora que tiene lentes con una casaca verde. Esta muy emocionada y agradecida por que de esta forma va a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This group is named “A Trabajar”.

Paulina is the group president. She is married and has a son who is currently abroad. Paulina lives with her husband, her daughter-in-law, and her three granddaughters. She and her husband work together selling crab meat. Paulina started working 20 years ago back when her husband was a taxi driver. They were not earning enough household income, but she knew a friend who was in this type of business. Now she has several customers, including restaurants and markets, and sells to them in bulk quantities.

With this loan, Paulina will buy more crabs so that she can improve her earnings. She already has several orders, so she wants to complete them now. Paulina’s dream is to keep growing since she has plans to use her savings to open a restaurant. In the photo, Paulina is the woman wearing glasses and a green jacket. She is very excited and appreciates having the chance to move forward.

loans.use: to buy crabs in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Tujinasue Group

texts.en:
Muhamedi, who is in his late 20s, is married and living together with his wife and their set of twins (a boy and a girl), aged one month.   

He has been running general store business for two years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase his business inventory and cover household expenses and rent.  He has paid back his loan successfully.  He requests a new loan to increase his business inventory and cover household expenses.  

His dream is to one day be able to widen his business and build his own nice house.

He will share this loan with his loan group " Tujinasue," which totals 21 members who hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase business inventory and cover household expenses.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity  is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes, shoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of funds for business expansion. 

Purity will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en: Zakaria is a 30-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from one year to seven years. He describes himself to be a caring and loving man. He operates a retail stall where he sells metal items such as boxes, gutters, etc . He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy metal items. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and cater for his family's financial needs. Zakaria also farms, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy metal items

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Goefrey is a 33-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 4 to 14 years. He describes himself to be independent. He operates a retail store where he sells slippers. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located within a busy town and his primary customers are local residents, tourists, and businesspeople. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes, especially during sunny days as it discolours the slippers, which customers then shun away from buying. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy slippers. His business goal is to build a permanent business store within five years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy slippers

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 40 years old and lives in the town of Najera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. In the past year, Gilbert has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which rears chickens. 

To help expand his business, Gilbert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken birds for the farm that will be sold, and will help Gilbert to generate greater profits and increase his source of income. Gilbert hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open up a wholesale business. 

Gilbert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gilbert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more chicken birds for the farm that will be sold

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: Luis de 61 años de edad tiene una miscelánea, cuyos principales productos son las artesanías, como mecedores, sillas,  la papelería y accesorios femeninos y domésticos. Sus 20 años de experiencia le indican cada día lo que tiene que hacer en sus ventas, ya que su negocio lo inició desde el año 1992, cuando aprendió de su cuñado la actividad comercial en la que hoy trabaja.  Con su negocio genera el sustento de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos, hoy en las edades de 16, 17 y 35 años. En su local vende principalmente de contado y trabaja de lunes a domingo en un horario extendido, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde; Luis realiza sus compras de contado en fábricas  especializadas y vende en diversas comunidades de la ciudad, además del barrio donde habita y tiene su negocio.  Su meta es ampliar el surtido pues cada vez mas, crece su clientela y en épocas como el último trimestre del año, es aun mas amplio el pedido de mercancías, porque sus clientes compran en esta temporada, debido a que tienen dinero reunido producto de su trabajo, de bonificaciones y primas laborales y esto hace que aumente la frecuencia de sus compras varias veces a la semana. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, pues desea comprar en mayor volumen y disminuir esta frecuencia, para generar menos gastos de transporte y mejores posibilidades de obtener descuentos. Esta es justamente la razón de éxito al solicitar el presente credikiva, con el cual comprará mecedoras y sillas tejidas, productos de misceláneas y papelería navideña. Su meta mas adelante es lograr hacer mejoramiento a su vivienda, para que su bienestar sea aun mayor y brindarle a su familia un ambiente confortable en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Luis, 61 years old, has a general store. His main products include arts and crafts, such as rocking chairs, normal chairs, paper products, feminine products, and domestic accessories. His 20 years of experience allows him to know what he should sell every day, since his business started in 1992. He learned from an early age the activities that he now does for a living.

With his business, he sustains his family, made up of his spouse and their three kids, today of ages 16, 17, and 35 years. In his location, he principally does business in cash, and works from Monday to Sunday with a schedule that extends from 7am to 6pm. Luis makes his sales in cash for specialized fabrics and sells in various communities of the city, in addition to the neighborhood that he lives in and where he has his business. His goal is to increase his assortment of goods and his customer base more and more. In times such as the final trimester of the year, the demand for goods is even higher, because his customers buy more at this time. This is due to the fact that they have money to buy products from his store, from bonuses and work premiums, and this causes him to make purchases more frequently throughout the week.

This is the reason for which he is asking for a loan from Kiva, because he wants to buy a larger volume and reduce the frequency with which he has to restock, in order to generate less expenses from transport and higher possibility to obtain discounts. This is the exact reason for the success of his present loan, with which he will purchase rocking chairs, woven chairs, miscellaneous products and wrapping paper (for Christmas). His goal for the future is to earn a better life, so that his well-being will be better and he can bring his family a comfortable living situation in their own house.

loans.use: to buy rocking chairs, woven chairs, miscellaneous products and wrapping paper for his general store.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI”  iniciará el ciclo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Irene es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de material de construcción, costura, venta de verduras, venta de ropa , tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Irene es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hija que es socia de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana hace años, desde esa fecha ella trabaja en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención.
texts.en:
The “Sartasiñani” communal bank will start the 7th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided by Irene.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of economic activities among which there is building supplies sales, sewing, vegetable sales, clothing sales and neighborhood store.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen one of which is Irene.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for three years having joined thanks to an invitation from her daughter who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a sewing business.  She relates that she learned this business years ago from her sister.  She’s worked in it since then.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital; she will buy fabric in wholesale stores to use to make things to then sell in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her home the best way possible since she’s in a common law relationship and has four children.   When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the service.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Niño De Insinche Group

texts.es:
Hasta hace pocos el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles. 
Mónica reside en Chillogallo un barrio ubicado en el sector sur de la ciudad, un sector con una alta actividad comercial que es cada vez más fortalecida y que aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios. Mónica tiene 34  años, es soltera, cursó la escuela primaria, vive con su pareja José de 40 años que se dedica a la carpintería y tienen 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, negocio al cual le dedica hasta 8 horas cada día paralelamente a la educación de sus hijos y brindarles tiempo necesario para no desatenderlos, se unió con sus amigas para juntas fortalecer sus negocios y poder sacar adelante a sus familias. 
Teresa tiene 36 años, cursó la escuela primaria, vive en unión libre con su pareja Rubén, que es carpintero, tienen 4 hijos, y se dedican a la carpintería, pero Teresa específicamente realiza marcos de madera para cuadros, solicita un préstamo para mejorar la estructura del negocio y comprar materia prima y herramientas para así ganar más clientes e incrementar sus ingresos. A pesar de la falta de apoyo a las actividades artesanales, Teresa ha buscado la forma de sustentar a su familia con las ganancias de este negocio.
Verónica es la más joven de todas, tiene 28 años y es soltera, vive en el barrio de Chillogallo en Quito, cursó la secundaria, vive con su pareja Marco de 31 años que trabaja como herrero y tienen 2 hijos. Verónica se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos, actividad a la cual le dedica al menos 6 horas diarias pero intenta también pasar tiempo con sus hijos. Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos para mantener el stock y surtido de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Until a few years ago, the southern part of the city of Quito wasn't considered among the strong economic areas of the capital of the Republic of Ecuador.  Now this area is considered an economic force in the city.  Here there are enterprising families who have struggled to stand out.  Between natives and migrants from other cities and countries, it has been a point of encounter of residents of various provinces, and it is built with extensive streets.  What stands out in this area are the parks with extensive green areas where families get together on the weekend.  All types of services are available, and the residents are entrepreneurs who make the most of every opportunity that comes up with the establishment of new businesses.

Mónica lives in Chillogallo, a neighborhood located in the southern part of the city.  It's an area with a lot of commercial activity, which increases all the time and contributes in large part to the economic growth of the city.  Mónica, 34, is single.  She finished elementary school and lives with her partner José, 40, who makes a living as a carpenter, and they have three children.  She makes a living raising and selling chickens, a business she does up to eight hours a day parallel to her children's education, so she'll give them the time they need and not neglect them.  She got together with her friends to strengthen their businesses together and be able to get their families ahead.

Teresa, 36, finished elementary school.  She lives in a common-law relationship with her partner, Ramón, a carpenter.  They have four children and make a living in carpentry, but Teresa specifically makes wood frames for paintings.  She's requesting a loan to improve the structure of her business and to buy materials and tools to attract more customers and increase her income.  Despite the lack of support for artisanal activities, Teresa has tried to find a way to support her family with the profits from this business.

Verónica is the youngest of all.  She's 28 years old and single.  She lives in the Chillogallo neighborhood of Quito.  She finished secondary school.  She lives with her partner Marco, 31, who works as a blacksmith, and they have two children.  Verónica makes a living selling cosmetics as a street vendor, which she does at least six hours a day, but she also tries to spend time with her children.  She'll invest the loan in buying products to maintain the stock and supply of her merchandise.

loans.use: to stock, increase, and improve her products and the structure of the business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 47 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6, James has been working hard to manage his business, which is a small wholesale clothes shop. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes that would fit different ages for resale.  This will help him to generate greater profits and earn more money to provide for his family. James hopes that in the future he will be able to open other clothes stores. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is a 50 year old married female from Al Salt in Jordan. She has 6 children and has requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and expenses. In the future, Nawal is planning to build an additional room onto her house.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Pititos Group

texts.es:
Ellas son el grupo de Pititos. Se hacen llamar así debido a que son comandas por Guadalupe, a quien de cariño le dicen “Pititos”. Guadalupe es una mujer de lucha y emprendedora. Busca constantemente salir adelante por sus propios medios y reconoce en los medios las alternativas para invertir en su negocio.
Se comprometió con este crédito para poder invertir en mercancía para su negocio, pues tiene vista en las compras decembrinas y con ello tener mejores ganancias y seguir creciendo su negocio.
Guadalupe, trabaja día a día para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es un ejemplo de perseverancia.
texts.en:
These women comprise the Pititos group. They are named after the leader of their group, Guadalupe, whose nickname is "Pititos". Guadalupe is a fighter and an entrepreneur. She is always trying to get ahead on her own and looking for alternative resources to invest in her business. 

Guadalupe requested this loan in order to buy merchandise for her business, with an eye towards December sales. She expects to increase her earnings and continue growing her business. 

Guadalupe works hard every day to have a better quality of life. She is an example of perseverance.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 57 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de instruirse y desde niño ayudó a sus padres en las labores de agricultura. Está casado con María de 54 años, no tienen hijos y viven en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. Roberto reside en la Parroquia Luz de América de este cantón, un sector que es considerado como el portón de entrada a la Provincia, por la riqueza de su tierra ha sido el nido de varias empresas productoras de alimentos además que es la zona de mayor producción de papaya, fruta exótica exportada desde aquí. Es por esto que los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura, lo cual ha sido la motivación para que varios emprendedores de la zona fortalezcan esta actividad con su trabajo, experiencia y  esfuerzo.
En varias partes de la ciudad se encuentran terrenos produciendo todo tipo de cultivos, en uno de ellos se encuentra Roberto quien ya lleva 40 años en la actividad de la agricultura. Todo el día trabaja sembrando, cosechando, fumigando y realizando todas las actividades que la obtención de un producto final de calidad demanda. Con la ayuda de su esposa logra buenos resultados a pesar de las pérdidas de cultivos que se dan por los cambios de clima inesperados y los fenómenos naturales que llegan a la zona en ciertas épocas del año. El obstáculo más grande que siempre ha tenido Roberto es la falta de recursos económicos para invertir en su negocio, pero ahora encontró a Fundación Alternativa quienes a través de los préstamos de Kiva le han brindado la facilidad de acceder a un crédito que lo utilizará para comprar semillas e insumos para la siembra y cuidado de sus cultivos. Roberto espera que con este incremento en su producción sus ingresos sean mayores así suplir las necesidades de él y su esposa y además tener un ahorro para sostenerse en su vejez.
texts.en:
Roberto is a man of 57. He did not have the opportunity for an education, and from childhood he helped his parents in agricultural work. He is married to Maria, who is 54 years old, and they have no children. They live in Santo Domingo canton in the province of Santo Domingo of the Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo connects the mountain region with the coastal region of Ecuador. It is a city that has become a commercial axis with various growth sectors, and as proof can be taken a number of entrepreneurial families who began some years ago with little businesses and now are microentrepreneurs who contribute to the generation of employment. Studies reveal that the majority of all businesses began empirically and were welcomed by the passage of tourists, businesspeople, and travelers who move from one region to another, and in addition, the city has the third largest population in the country. 

Roberto lives in the Luz de America parish of this canton, a sector that is considered the port of entry to the province. Because of the richness of its land, it has been the origin of various food-producing businesses, in addition to being an area with great production of papayas, an exotic fruit exported from here. It is for this reason that the great majority of the inhabitants of this parish work in agriculture, which has been the motivation for various entrepreneurs of this zone to strengthen this activity with their work, experience, and effort.

In a number of parts of the city are lands producing all types of crops. On one of these is Roberto, who has already worked in agriculture for 40 years. He works all day, planting, harvesting, fumigating, and doing all the work that obtaining a final product of good quality demands. With the help of his wife, he achieves good results in spite of the losses of crops that occur because of unexpected weather changes and natural phenomena that arrive in the area at certain times of the year. The greatest obstacle that he has always had is the lack of economic resources to invest in his business, but now he has found Fundación Alternativa, which, through the Kiva loans, has offered him the convenience of accessing a loan that he will use to buy seeds and supplies for planting and caring for his crops. Roberto hopes that with this increase in his production, his income will be greater and will thus supply the necessities for him and his wife, and in addition he will have some savings to sustain them in their old age.

loans.use: to buy seeds and increase his production

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario es casado tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en casa propia, en un acabado de pared de adobe, acabado de piso es de tierra, el nivel de pobreza es alta, ocupa dos habitaciones en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de la Paz.

Mario trabaja como gastronómico, su esposa es empleada doméstica y con lo poco que ganan, ambos cubren los gastos de servicios básicos de agua, luz y gastos de alimentación, muchas veces Mario trabaja por más de ocho horas al día.

El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de la cocina ya que instalará gas domiciliario.

El sueño de Mario es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que la instalación de gas a su domicilio le favorecerá mucho con los gastos, éste cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con el crédito ya que lo ayudará mucho.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda con Kiva.
texts.en:
Mario’s married and has a little boy; he lives in his own house made of adobe and with dirt floors.  The level of poverty is high.  He occupies two bedrooms in the city of La Paz’s Villa Ingenio zone.

Mario works as a cook and his wife’s a domestic employee and with the little they earn they cover basic water, electricity and food costs; Mario often works more than 8 hours daily.  He needs the loan to upgrade the kitchen because he’s going to install residential gas service.

Mario’s dream is to improve his family’s quality of life and installing gas at home will reduce costs greatly.  He’s very satisfied with the loan since it will be of great help to him.  This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and second with KIVA too.

loans.use: to prepare the kitchen for residential gas installation.

loans.name: Acuario Group

texts.es:
Acuario esta integrada por un grupo de mujeres que se han impuesto emprender sus propios negocios.
Cada una de ellas con aspiraciones y deseos de sobresalir, se encontraron en un mismo empleo, a raíz de esto, han descubierto que tienen una fortaleza para poder iniciar sus propios negocios.
Ariana, es madre de dos hijos y esta decidida a darles una mejor educación y calidad de vida de la que ella ha vivido.
Se ha motivado para iniciar la venta de zapatos y es por eso, que hoy toma el crédito para poder invertir en mercancía y así iniciar su negocio.
Ariana esta convencida que esta es una buena decisión.
texts.en:
Acuario comprises a group of women who have decided to set up their own businesses. With their own individual aspirations and hopes for success, the women found themselves working in the same job. It was from there they realised that they have the strength to start their own businesses. 

Ariana is a mother of two children. She is determined to give her children a better education and quality of life than she had herself. This has motivated her to start selling shoes and so she is asking for a loan in order to invest in stock and get her business going. Ariana is sure that this is a good decision.

loans.use: to invest in shoe stock.

loans.name: Las Picositas Group

texts.es:
Ellas son vecinas del municipio de Apodaca, un grupo de mujeres entusiastas y decididas a salir adelante.  
Ilda, una de sus integrantes se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda desde hace 10 años, y ahora que ha pertenecido en el grupo la han motivado para que invierta en ropa de primera y con ello tenga mejores rendimientos.
Me vio muy motivada y confiada en que le puede ir bien debido a conoce el mercado. 
Ilda abraza este nuevo reto con mucha energía y convencida de que esta inversión traerá progreso para su ella y su familia.
texts.en: This is a group of enthusiastic women who are determined to get ahead in life. The group is made up of neighbors from the Apodaca municipality. One of the members of the group, Ilda, has worked selling second-hand clothes for the last 10 years and, since she became part of the group, has become motivated to invest in new clothing in order to increase her profits. She is very enthusiastic and sure that she will be successful because she knows the market well. Ilda is going to give her all to this new challenge, and is sure that this investment will be a step forward for both her and her family.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Fullah Group

texts.en:
Alimamy is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alimamy was born in Makeni City in Northern Sierra Leone about 33 years ago. He is married to a trader, and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. Currently, Alimamy sells electronics like tape recorders, radios, cassette players, etc. 

With the help of this loan, Alimamy and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Alimamy will use his share of the loan (700,000 Leone) to buy more electronic goods to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy more electronic goods to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Najah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her brother. Najah is a 35-year-old married woman who has two family members from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 600 JD (Jordan dinar) to pay for her home improvements; she would like to repaint her home and to do maintenance on the home. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements (painting and maintenance).

loans.name: Doncellas Group

texts.es:
Doncellas es un grupo pequeño, integrado por 5 mujeres que se conocen muy bien y los 5 ciclos que llevan con el crédito nunca han batallado con los pagos.
Julia es una mujer joven y sobresaliente de 27 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 1 años y un bebe de 7 meses. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, ya tiene 2 años con ella y el crédito lo utilizara para surtir más su negocio por la temporada navideña.
Julia nos menciona que quiere poner una pequeña papelería, ya que ahorita su negocio esta dando muchos frutos, además de que le gustaría seguir con este giro.
texts.en: Doncellas is a small group made up of five women who know each other very well. They have never had any problems with payments the five times they have obtained loans. Julia is a young and outstanding 27-year-old woman. She lives in a common-law marriage, and has two children of 10 and 1 years and a baby of 7 months. She has a grocery store in her house. She has had it for two years, and she will use the loan to stock her business some more for the Christmas season. Julia says that she wants to put in a small stationery store, since right now her business is doing really well and she would like to continue in this way.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store some more for the Christmas season

loans.name: Balcones Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO BALCONES ESTA INTEGRADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES,ELLAS SON CLIENTES DE DE HACE VARIOS CICLOS EN CREDITUYO, 
ELLAS SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO.
ESTE GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR DORA,GLORIA,LIDIA ANEL Y MARTHA EN ESTE CASA HABLAREMOS DE MARTHA, 
ELLA SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE ROPA USADA EN LOS MERCADOS, EL PRESATAMO LO PIENSA UTLIZAR EN COMPRAR UNA ESTRAUCTURA MAS GRANDE, YA QUE QUIERE AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO,EL SUEÑO DE MARTHA ES, LLEGAR A TENER UNA BOUTIQUE GRANDE EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. YA QUE AL ESTAR VENDIENDO EN LOS MERCADOS RODANTES, NO VENDE LO QUE ELLA QUISIERA COMO EN EL CASO DE TEMPÓRADA DE LLUVIA.
texts.en:
The group “Balcones” has five members.  They have been clients of Credituyo through several loan cycles.  They are merchants.  The members of this group are Dora, Gloria, Lidia, Anel and Martha.
                
In this case we will talk about Martha.  She sells used clothing in markets.  She is planning to use the loan to purchase a larger stall because she would like to expand her business.  Martha's dream is to acquire a large boutique in the middle of the city. Given that she sells in street markets, she doesn't sell as much as she would like, especially during the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase a large stall.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna is a local farmer from the district of Moung Koul Borey in the province of Banteay Meanchey. She is a widow with five children. Currently, two of her children are under her dependency, as they are still in school. Vanna grows rice paddies on two hectares of farmland, from which she is able to earn about 13,200 KHR. She has been in this business for quite some time. Vanna's group consists of two members. As first-time borrower, she is seeking for a new loan in the amount of 100,000 KHR. Vanna, the group leader, will use her portion to purchase two sacks of fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes that this purchase will help her earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 38-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. Six years ago he decided to venture into a general merchandise trade. The business has so far helped him in providing basics to his family. Like all good fathers, he wishes to educate his children up to the university level and set up sustainable income-generating activities. His hardship is price fluctuation. His desire is to own a wholesale shop. Fred intends to use this loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: El Cisne Group

texts.es:
El grupo el cisne esta conformado por 7 integrantes dos de ellos hombres y 5 mujeres todos los integrantes pertenecen  a  la misma comunidad, el nombre del grupo lo eligió una persona que ya no esta en le grupo, el grupo lleva mucho tiempo trabajando con la institución algunos integrantes han salido pero también ingresan nuevos, así que el nombre lo eligió don Manuel suponen los integrantes recientes porque el criaba gansos en ese entonces.
Doña Eva quien tambien forma parte del grupo tiene 63 años de edad es viuda ya no tiene quien dependa de ella ahora slo vive cercas de uno de sus hijos y convive con sus nietos aparte del grupo gracias al crédito se ha beneficiado con los prestamos, ya que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a compra y venta de cerdos y con eso pudo mejorar su vivienda y poner una tienda de abarrotes, esta vez ha esta invirtiendo en su negocio de renta de sillas y mesas para eventos especiales en la comunidad o en otras comunidades vecinas, se las van a pedir rentadas cuando tiene bautizos, primeras comuniones, salidas de escuela y es cuando le va mejor.
Tiene 60 mesas con 108 sillas, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 60 manteles para sus mesas, las mesas las trajo de México y casi cumple un año en el negocio su esperanza es llegar a tener mas sillas para darle un mejor servicios a su clientes ya que era uno de sus desafíos porque no luego no puede a completar el muro de sillas o mesas que le solicitan. los integrantes del grupo están agradecidos y contentos por el préstamo se han comprometido a no quedar con el préstamo, cada uno de ellos invertirá en actividades diferentes, Luisa en cerdos, Lucila comprara maíz para su tortillas, Marco Antonio comprar pollo para su pollería, Juana invertirá en maíz y alimenta para cerdos, Hermelinda para asbestos,Manuel comprara borregos.
texts.en:
The group “El Cisne” (The Swan) consists of seven members, two men and five women. All of them are from the same community. The name of the group was chosen by a person who is no longer a member. This group has worked a long time with Fundación Realidad, so some members have left while new ones have joined. This name was chosen by Don Manuel and the more recent members believe he was raising geese at the time.

Doña Eva is also a member of this group. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has no dependents. Eva currently lives near one of her children, but she has a grandchild who lives with her now that her family is not together. Thanks to her access to credit, she has been able to benefit from the loans. Eva previously bought and sold pigs and used her profits to improve her home. She opened a grocery store, but also invested in a business of renting out chairs and tables for special events in the community and the surrounding areas. Her services are requested for baptisms, first communions, school graduations, and other events in which she does her best. Eva has 60 tables and 108 chairs, so she is requesting a loan so that she can buy 60 tablecloths for covering the tables. The tables were brought in from Mexico City and she has been in business for almost a year. She hopes to have more chairs so that she can provide better service to her customers. One of her challenges is not being able to fulfill a request for enough tables and chairs.

The other members of the group are appreciative and pleased with their loans, so they have promised to keep up with them. Each member will invest in different activities: • Luisa will buy pigs. • Lucila will buy corn for making tortillas. • Marco Antonio will buy chickens for his chicken shop. • Juana will invest in corn and feed for her pigs. • Hermelinda will buy provisions. • Manuel will buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Don Ismael es cliente desde hace variomeses dentro de la institución por lo que es una persona que se puede platicar muy a gusto cuando le comentamos sobre su historia de éxito se emociono saber le tomaríamos la foto, es por eso que nos otorgo la entrevista en ella nos cuenta que tiene 37 años de edad vive en una comunidad mazahua que lleva por nombre San Agustín Mextepec está casado con la señora Guadalupe desde hace 16 años juntos han procreado 3 niños que van ala escuela.
Don Ismael tiene una zapatería desde hace que era niño el sabia como vender zapatos ya que sus padres fueron los fundadores del negocio y del mercado donde se venden los zapatos, pero ahora ya tiene un negocio propio que aunque viene de sus padres don Ismael es quien la atiende y se encarga de ella, Don Ismael esta solicitando el crédito para comprar más zapatos como, botas, tenis, zapatillas, sandalias, etc. para dama, caballero, niña y niños. Nos cuenta que le crédito le ayudara de mucho ya que podrá invertir mas en su negocio y mas que nada porque para Don Ismael se acercan las temporadas buenas y no tendrá que preocuparse en mucho tiempo para para comprar mercancía.
Sin embargo la dificultad a la cual presenta es muchas veces no vende y por falta de dinero no puede invertir mas en su negocio también porque acaba de pasar por la enfermedad de su esposa de eco también cuenta que le gusta mucho el campo tenia borregos y un sembradío de nopales, aunque los borregos los vendió para solventar los gastos que se originaban acusa de la enfermedad de sus esposo.
Pero Don Ismael es una persona muy trabajador responsable y tiene metas como echarle mugas ganas a su negocio de zapatos ya que recuerda que algún tiempo le fue muy bien en la venta de sus zapatos y quisiera  vender como antes para mejorar la calidad de sus hijos y esposa considera que por falta de dinero no puede levantarse pero hará todo lo posible para levantarse nuevamente.
Es un padre de familia muy trabajador por lo que esta muy agradecido con frac y kiva por el apoyo que le brindan y esperar no quedar mal.
texts.en:
Ismael has been a client of the institution for a few months. He is a person who can talk very comfortably when we comment on his history of success. He was excited knowing we would take the picture. This is why he gave us the interview. 

He tells us that he is 37 years old and lives in a Mazahua community called San Agustín Mextepec. He has been married to Guadalupe for 16 years, and together they have 3 children who attend school. Ismael has a shoe store. From the time he was a child, he knew how to sell shoes, since his parents were the founders of the business and of the market where they sell the shoes. Now he has his own business. Although it comes from his parents, Ismael is the one who tends to it and is in charge of it. Ismael is asking for the loan in order to purchase more shoes such as boots, tennis shoes, high heels, sandals, etc. for women, men, girls, and boys. 

He tells us that the loan will help him a lot since he will be able to invest more in his business and more than anything, the good seasons are coming and he will not have to worry about buying merchandise for a long time. Nevertheless, the difficulty he faces is that many times he doesn't sell and due to lack of money, he cannot invest more in his business.  He also recently got through his wife's illness. He also says that he likes the countryside a lot and had sheep and a field of cactus, although he sold the sheep to cover the costs resulting from the illness of his wife. 

But Ismael is a very hard-working and responsible person and he has goals, such as to put everything into his shoe business.  He remembers that his shoe sales were once very good, and he would like to sell like before in order to improve the quality of life for his children and wife. He thinks that due to lack of money he will not be able to raise himself up, but he will do everything possible to get himself ahead again. He is a very hard-working family man, and he is very grateful to FRAC and Kiva for the support they give him, and he hopes it does not turn out badly.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, boots, and tennis shoes for men and women

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Nueva Opcion Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Nueva Opción” está conformado por seis mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras en sus actividades productivas, todas viven en una misma comunidad donde se caracteriza por el cultivo de maíz pero además por la crianza de animales, la comunidad la hace ver muy bonita por un cerro que se encuentra muy cercas de donde viven las integrantes, platicaron que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque para ellas solicitar un crédito a la institución la consideran una nueva opción y muy buena opción le gusto mucho trabajaba la empresa y fue como decidieron solicitar crédito para sus actividades. Doña Ofelia quien es la representan del grupo platica que tienen varios años trabajando con la institución, tiene 47 años de edad esta casada con el señor José juntos formaron una familia con hijos de los cuales ya solo un depende de ellos, Doña Ofelia tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 26 años y la inicio porque antes la comunidad casi no tenia tienda de abarrotes fue como Doña Ofelia decidió iniciar su tienda de abarrotes, aunque inicio vendiendo solo unos dulces y refrescos en donde no tenia una vitrina bien establecida pero con el tiempo su negocio ha crédito y ahora está muy bien disfrutando del negocio esta vez esta solicitando un nuevo crédito a la institución para poder comprar las productos de abarrotes, ya que necesita para poder surtir su tienda ya que gracias al crédito Doña Ofelia tendrá su 	lo que sus clientes necesiten y no tengan que irse con la competencia en la actualidad esa es una dificultad que tiene doña Ofelia es la competencia es por eso que un crédito le será de gran ayuda, Ayuda para su negocio pero también para cumplir el sueño de doña Ofelia nos comento “Mi sueño es hacer crecer mi negocio para poder mejorar nuestra calidad de vida pero también la de mi hijo que aun depende de mi” las integrantes también tienen sueños es por eso que están solicitan un nuevo crédito  a la institución como por ejemplo Cristina y Nancy compraran borregos para su venta, Ana comprar Guajolotes y Edith comprara una Res para engorda y venta.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Opción” [New Option] communal bank is comprised of six very hard-working and enterprising women that have productive business activities.  All of them live in the same community, which is known for its corn crops and for raising animals.  The community looks very beautiful as seen from a hill that is very close to where the members live.  They say that they selected the name of the group because they are requesting a loan from the institution, which they consider to be a new option and a very good option.  They really like working with the enterprise, and that is how they decided to request a loan for their business activities.

Ofelia, who represents the group, says that they have been working with the institution for several years.  She is 47 years old, and she is married to José.  They formed a family and had children, but only one is now dependent upon them.  Ofelia has had a grocery store for 26 years.  She started it because the community did not have hardly any grocery stores.  That is how Ofelia decided to start her grocery store.  She started by only selling candy and soft drinks where she did not have a well-established display case.  

However, in time her business has grown, and now she is enjoying her business very much.  This time she is requesting a new loan from the institution in order to be able to buy grocery products.  She needs to be able to stock her store.  Thanks to the loan, Ofelia will have what her customers need, and they won’t have to go to the competition.  That is why a loan will be a big help.  

It will help her business, but it will also help fulfill Ofelia’s dream.  Ofelia told us, “My dream is to make my business grow in order to be able to improve our quality of life and that of my son, who is still dependent upon me.”

The members also have dreams.  That is why they are requesting a new loan from the institution.  For example, Cristina and Nancy will buy lambs to sell.  Anna will buy turkeys, and Edith will buy a cow to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy groceries like salt, sugar, detergent, and soft drinks, etc.

location.town: San Juan Jalpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Sol's Group

texts.en:
Sol, 24, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a married mother of two dependent daughters who help the family’s business. Her family’s income comes from farming a leased four-hectare rice paddy. She has been in this business for ten years. From the current business, Sol can earn about KHR 20,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 10,000 for future needs. 

This is the first microloan for Sol with Kiva partner VisionFund. She and her other group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the group leader, Sol is going to use most of her money to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland, and devote a portion of it to labor for plowing the rice field. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthfully so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is a 34-year-old married woman from Al Koorah, Jordan. She has 3 children. Nour has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for working in flower designing and embroidery. in the future, she plans to have her own shop.

loans.use: to pay for working in flower designing and emroidery

loans.name: Majedah

texts.en: Majedah is a 41-year-old married woman who has four family members from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JD (Jordan dinar) to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to buy more furniture and to repaint her home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: Don  Alvaro tiene 37 años de edad, es casado su esposa es ama de casa tienen dos hijos uno cursa la escuela primaria y otro la secundaria, siendo el único que trabaja como ayudante de albañil le es muy difícil ya que cubre con todos los gastos del  hogar. Poco a poco ha ido haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda con solicitudes de créditos hasta llegar a hacer su casa de concreto, este es su tercer préstamo con Afodenic que lleva como objetivo la construcción de un anexo que será un cuarto para sus hijos y para lograr levantar la obra necesita comprar cemento, hierro, perlines, bloques, piedrín y pagar la mano de obra. Esto le ayudara para continuar acondicionando su hogar y lograr darle a su familia un lugar seguro y las condiciones necesarias para vivir.
texts.en:
Alvaro is thirty-seven years old and is married.  His wife is a homemaker and they have two children; one is in elementary school, and the other is in secondary school.  He is the only one who works; he is a bricklayer's helper.  It is very difficult to cover all of the home expenses.

Little by little, he has been making improvements to his home with loan requests so that he can make his house concrete.  This is his third loan with Afodenic.  His objective is to construct a room for his children; to do this work, he needs to buy cement, iron bars, purlins, blocks, building rocks, and to pay the workers.  

This will help him to continue adapting his home and he will be able to give his family a safe place, and the necessary conditions, in which to live.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron bars, purlins, blocks, building rocks, and to pay the workers to construct a room.

loans.name: Yamily Nayu

texts.es:
Yamaly es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Mala, al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchísimo, Yamaly es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella logro estudiar la carrera técnica  de contabilidad, pero debido a que no pudo encontrar empleo ella con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Yamaly está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, conservas, fideos, entre otros; de esta manera ella podra tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño: Tener un minimarket y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Yamaly is a young 20-year-old woman who lives in the city of Mala with her parents whom she loves very much. Yamaly is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead. She was able to study toward a technical career in accounting. However, due to the fact that she was not able to find work, she started her own business selling groceries with a lot of effort and her savings. With the income from her work, she is able to support her parents with the household expenses. She believes that her work is going well because she is very friendly with her customers and, above all, because she offers quality products at good prices. 

Yamaly is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help offered that has been offered she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business like rice, jams, noodles, and other things. In this way she will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer and continue struggling to realize her greatest dream: to have a mini market and support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, jams, noodles, and others)

loans.name: Faustino Aparicio

texts.es:
Faustino es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Faustino no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Faustino trabaja en su mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Faustino se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder hacer la construcción de los servicios higiénicos de su hogar; de esta manera Faustino contará con su vivienda en mejores condiciones, más adecuadas y seguras para su él y su familia, así pues Faustino  desea seguir esforzándose para logara sus metas y su sueño de tener su propia empresa de servis.
texts.en:
Faustino is a 48-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his wife and three children whom he loves and who are his main focus in life.  Faustino is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, puts all his efforts into getting his family ahead in life.  Unfortunately, Faustino was not able to study for a teaching degree but he would very much have liked to have done so.  In his free time, he enjoys continuing to work and sometimes his wife cooks delicious 'tallarines rojos' (red spaghetti) to share with their family. 

Faustino works with a lot of effort and dedication every day in his motorcycle taxi, providing transport services.  Every day, from early in the morning, he drives round the streets of the city looking for passengers.  He can work approximately 10 hours a day and he believes that he is doing well because he treats his customers in a friendly and respectful way.

Faustino is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to improve his home.  He would like to be able to build a bathroom for his household.  This will improve the conditions in Faustino's home and it will become safer for both him and his family.  Faustino would like to continue working hard to achieve his goals.  His dream is to have his own company.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in his home

loans.name: Phiona's Group

texts.en:
Joy's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Joy is 23 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Joy has been working hard to manage her saloon, which sells hair extensions. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used  to get more products for the saloon and will help Joy to generate greater profits and increase the business. Joy hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big business. 

Joy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Diana Karina

texts.es: Diana vive en un sector norte de Guayaquil llamado las Orquídeas, es casada tiene 2  hijos que estudian en una escuela pública del sector. Ella comenzó hace 4 años atrás cuando su suegro le regalo una maquina de estampado y fue cuando le dio la idea a su esposo para un crear negocio propio que es la venta de globos estampados. En la actualidad venden globos estampados. Ellos trabajan juntos de lunes a viernes en las noches los estampan y en el día salen a vender los globos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar fundas de globos. Su sueño es tener un local propio y expandir su negocio por otros sectores
texts.en:
Diana lives in a northern sector of Guayaquil called las Orquídeas.  She is married and has two children who study at a public school in the neighborhood.  

Diana began four years ago when her father-in-law gave her a embossing machine.  This gave her husband the idea to start their own business selling embossed balloons, which they currently sell.  They work together from Monday to Friday:  they emboss them in the evenings and during the day, they go out to sell the balloons.

With the loan, she would like to buy bags of balloons.  Her dream is to have her own store and expand her business into other sectors.

loans.use: to buy bags of balloons

loans.name: Mery Lorena

texts.es: Sandoya  vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Ella comenzó con el negocio de bazar y papelería hace 1 año atrás. Compro una vitrina y perchas ahí ella vende láminas, cuadernos hasta artículos de bazar. Ella atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño es ampliarlo más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que día  a día le compran en su bazar. Su sueño es arreglar su vivienda y  comprarse un carro. Con el préstamo quiere comprar  artículos para el bazar, papeles, láminas,  etc.
texts.en:
Sandoya lives in the Orquídes area north of the city of Guayaquil.  She started with her variety and stationery business one year ago.  She bought a display case and some racks, and that is where she sells illustrated prints, notebooks, and even novelty items.  She tends to her small business alone. She starts work at 8:00 a.m., and she works until 10:00 p.m.

She says that in the beginning there was a lot of delinquency in her area, and her business was not very productive.  Little by little, these conditions have been improving.  Now her business is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand it more in order to be able to meet the needs of her consumers who shop at her store day to day.

Her dream is to fix up her house and to buy a car.  She wants to use the loan to buy novelty items, papers, and illustrated prints, etc.

loans.use: to buy novelty items, papers, and illustrated prints, etc.

loans.name: Friontina Sonia

texts.es:
Friontina es una mujer de 40naños, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con  su pequeño hijo de 6 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño ya que ella es madre y padre para él; lamentablemente Friontina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Friontina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de calzado, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, todas los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien, ya que gracias al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes, cuenta con  clientes seguros.
Friontina se siente muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como cemento, arena, fierros, tubos, etc.; de esta manera Friontina espera poder construir el segundo piso de su vivienda, el cual sea seguro, adecuado y brinde mayor bienestar para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Friontina is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pisco together with her 6-year-old son who she loves and who is her main focus in life.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into providing for her little one as she is both mother and father to him.  Unfortunately, Friontina was unable to study for a professional cookery qualification but she would have very much liked to have done so.  In her free time she likes taking part in sports and she sometimes cooks a delicious 'ají de gallina' to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Friontina works every day in her small shoe sales business.  She sells ladies', men's and children's footwear.  She starts work very early every day and is able to work approximately 12 hours a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she treats her customers well and she has a steady customer base.

Friontina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy building supplies such as cement, sand, iron, pipes, etc. in order to build a second floor on her home.  It will be safe, suitable and will improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Avercio

texts.es:
Avercio es un hombre de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con su esposa, tiene 3 hijos que son mayores, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa han dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Avercio no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con toda su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace varios años Avercio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 13 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Avercio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, gaseosas, menestras, entre otros abarrotes; de esta manera Avercio tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, para que así poco a poco pueda ampliar su negocio, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto a su familia salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Avercio is a 53 year old man who lives in the city of Chiclayo with his wife,  They have 3 children who are grown, who they love and consider to be their primary reason for living.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, along with his wife, dedicates himself fully to helping their family to get ahead in life.  Sadly, Avercio was not able to study at the university level, but he would have really liked to study accounting.  In his free time, he likes to watch the news on the television, and sometimes his wife cooks a rich meal of duck and rice to share with the whole family.

With a great deal of effort and dedication, for the past few years, Avercio has worked at a small business selling groceries.  Every day he begins work very early in the morning, and he sometimes works as much as 13 hours a day, and he thinks it is going well because of the kind attention that he gives his customers. 

Avercio is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that he will be able to make purchases of merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, oil, sodas, legumes, and other groceries.  In this manner, Avercio will have a better stocked storefront, and with this, he hopes to increase his sales and his level of income so that he can expand his business little by little.  Therefore, he will continue working and striving so that together with his family, he will improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, oil, sodas, legumes, etc.

loans.name: Melisa Teresa

texts.es:
Melisa es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora  entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Melisa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su pequeño.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace tres años Melisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección y costura de ropa, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Melisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña maquina remalladora semi industrial; de esta manera Melisa podrá realizar todo tipo de costuras, con ello espera poder aumentar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ir logrando su sueño de tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Melisa is a 20 year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her partner and small child, who she loves and considers to be her primary reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed.  Sadly, Melisa was not able to study at the university level, but she would have really liked to do so.  In her free time, she really enjoys playing with her little one.

By her own initiative, and with a great deal of effort and dedication, for the past three years, Melisa has had a small business sewing and tailoring clothing.  Every day, she begins work early in the morning, and she works for about 8 hours a day and thinks it is going well because of her dedication and the good treatment that she provides to her customers.

Melisa is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that she will be able to make the purchase of a small semi-industrial serging machine.  In this way, Melisa will be able to make all kinds of seams, and with this, she hopes to be able to expand her services and increase her income, which will serve her greatly in moving little by little toward achieving her dream of having her own house and giving a good education to her young son.

loans.use: to buy a semi-industrial serger (sewing machine).

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de un año, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tacu Tacu para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su hermano, Roger trabaja en una multicentro de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y responsabilidad.
Roger se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la implementación de su pequeño taller mecánico, así pues en poco tiempo Roger espera poder tener buenos clientes para poder sacar adelante su negocio, con ello poco a poco Roger desea poder ampliar su negocio y así asegurar la educación y bienestar de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Roger is a man of 33 years, who lives in the city of Pucallpa with his partner and their one year old toddler, who he loves and considers to be his primary reasons for living.   He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, along with his partner, dedicates all his efforts to helping their family to get ahead in life.  Thanks to his hard work and the support of his family, he was able to study a technical college course in auto mechanics.  In his free time, he likes to play football (soccer) with his friends, and he sometimes cooks a delicious meal of Tacu Tacu (a Peruvian traditional meal) to share with his family.

With a great deal of dedication and hard work, and thanks to the support of his brother, Roger currently works in a shopping mall in his city.  Every day he begins work very early in the morning, and he works as much as 12 hours a day, and he thinks it is going well because of his performance and responsibility.

Roger is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that he will be able to open his own small auto repair shop, and in a short while, Roger hopes to have a good customer base to advance his business, with which Roger wants to expand his business and assure the education and well-being of his child.

loans.use: to open his own auto repair shop.

loans.name: Jesus Lionel

texts.es:
Jesús es un hombre de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Jesús pudo estudiar la carrera de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos  momentos con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Jesús trabaja como profesor de matemáticas particular, él cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, donde dicta clases a sus alumnos, así también, en las noches vende frituras, tales como hamburguesas, pollo broaster, salchipapas y otros, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree  que le va bien por su paciencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jesús se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mesas y sillas; de esta manera Jesús tendrá su hogar mejor acondicionado para poder seguir dictando clases a sus alumnos, así pues Jesús seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y su gran sueño de terminar de construir su vivienda y ver a sus pequeños convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 29 year old man who lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and his two small children, who he loves and considers to be his primary reason for living.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, dedicates all their efforts to helping their family to get ahead in life. Thanks to his hard work Jesús was able to study at a university in the field of education.  In his free time, he likes to share quality time with his family.

By his own initiative, and with a great deal of dedication and hard work, Jesús works each day as a teacher of mathematics.  He has a small space in his house where he gives classes to his students, and at nights he also sells fried snacks in the evenings, like hamburgers, roasted chicken, salchipapas (hot dogs and fries), and other snacks.  He enjoys his work and thinks that it's going well thanks to his patience and the goodwill that he shares with everyone.

Jesús  is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy tables and chairs.  With this, Jesús will have a house that is better suited to continuing to have classes for his students. Jesús will continue working and making an effort to achieve his goals, and his greatest dream is to finish construction on his house and see his little ones grow up to have an education and good careers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Erika Lisbeth

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Erika no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, Erika trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, en especial de frituras, tales como salchipapas, hamburguesas, pollo broaster, entre otros, ella trabaja todos los días un aproximado de 6 horas y cree que le va bien su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Erika se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un carrito sanguchero, el cual le servirá de mucho para poder seguir vendiendo sus frituras, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco utilizará para tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Erika is a 25 year old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her partner and their two small children, who she loves and considers to be her primary reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, along with her partner, puts all her efforts toward helping her family to get ahead in life.  Sadly, Erika was not able to study at the university in the field of nursing because she had to start working at a very young age to help her parents.  In her free time, she likes to relax by listening to a little music and sometimes she cooks a delicious meal of Lomo Saltado (beef and potatoes) to share with her family.

With a great deal of dedication and effort, and thanks to the support of her partner, Erika works in a small business selling food, especially fried foods like salchipapas (sausage and fries), hamburgers, roasted chicken, and other items.  She works every day for about six hours, and she thinks her business is doing well because of the good seasonings she uses and the good service that she gives to her customers.

Erika is very thankful for the lenders at Kiva, since it is thanks to their help that she will be able to make the purchase of a small hot foods cart, which will serve her well in continuing to sell her foods. In this way, she hopes to increase her sales and her income, which she will use little by little to save and buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy a small hot food cart.

loans.name: Adelita Rocio

texts.es:
Adelita es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su madre y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Adelita no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a su madre.
