María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de maderos, alambres, fierros y otros materiales, para poder hacer la ampliación y un cercado más alto de su establo; de esta manera María seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is a 60-year-old woman and she lives in the city of Nazca.  She is a single mother and has three adult children.  She loves them dearly and they are the central focus in her life.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic woman that has put all of her efforts toward helping her family get ahead. Unfortunately, María was unable to complete elementary school because at an early age she had to work in order to help her parents with the household expenses.  In her free moments she likes to listen to music and sometimes she cooks a delicious Locro (a thick stew) to share with her family.

By her own initiative, and with a lot of struggle and dedication, María has run her own business of selling milk for many years.  She began with a small stable of cows that she bred so that she could obtain their milk and sell it.  María begins work in the early-morning hours and works for about 12 hours per day.  She feels lucky to have this work and believes that it has gone well due to her experience and because of the friendly service that she gives her customers.

María is very thankful for the Kiva loans and gives thanks for the help that they have brought her. With this loan she will buy wood, wire, iron, and other materials so that she can extend her stable and make a higher fence.  By doing this María will be able to continue working and striving to achieve her biggest dream: to complete the construction of her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y su pequeña hija de pocos meses de nacida, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña, ya que ella es padre y madre para su bebé; lamentablemente Carmen no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carmen trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y lo puede hacer por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulatoria y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como prendas de vestir y calzado, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños; de esta manera Carmen tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 20 years old and lives in Pisco with her parents and baby daughter who is only a few months old. She loves them and says that they are the most important thing in her life. She is a kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates her efforts to giving her small daughter a good start in life as she is both father and mother to the child. Unfortunately Carmen wasn't able to study a degree as from a young age she needed to work to help her parents with household costs. 

Through her own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, Carmen has her own business selling clothes and shoes. She works every day from early in the morning for approximately 8 hours. She is a mobile seller and believes that she is doing well because of the competitive prices she offers her customers. 

Carmen is very thankful to Kiva loaners, as thanks to their help she will be able to purchase more stock for her business such as clothing outfits and shoes for women, men and children. From this, Carmen will have a better stocked business and she will continue working and striving to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Felix no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina come una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca, el cual es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Felix trabaja en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, en el área de almacén, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Felix se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Felix se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso de concreto en su habitación, de esta manera él podrá contar un ambiente adecuado y seguro, que le brinde mayor bienestar; así pues Felix desea poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera y convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Felix is a young man of 19 years old. He is single and lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who really wants to improve himself. Due to the lack of money and the need to work, Felix was not able to study for the professional career in Law that he wanted, but he would very much like to be able to do it. In his spare time he enjoys watching television and sometimes cooks things like a delicious "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" (Pork stew with a noodle casserole), which is his favourite meal.

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Felix works in the warehouse of a transportation company in his city. He works every day from early in the morning and works for about 8 hours. Felix feels at ease working and believes that it is going well thanks to his diligence and the friendly attitude he has towards others.

Felix is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered he will be able to carry out improvements to his house. He wants to be able to plaster and paint his room, and also to install a concrete floor. This way he will be able to have a suitable and safe environment, which will help his well-being. Felix also wants to carry on working and striving to be able to realise his dream of studying for a career and becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Poto

texts.en:
Fuapine is 38 years old and is married with 10 children. She plans to start a retail business. Therefore, she has requested a loan to buy general products such as corned beef, tinned fish, a display cooler, a deep freezer, etc. 

Fuapine will use her profits to pay for her children's education and to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy corned beef, tinned fish, a display cooler, a deep freezer, etc.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a single parent and has two children. She sells African print cloth and fabrics at Elmina, which she has done for some years. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees. Comfort will use her loan to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is aged 41 years and has been in farming for six consecutive years. He currently runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. His farm produces mainly vegetables, maize and milk for the local market. He is married with four children aged between 6 and 18 years.

Michael has requested a loan of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will help produce milk both for resale and family consumption. He adds that he will use the animal waste as manure for the farm as well as producing bio-gas fuel for the family. He adds the income will help in paying for the education of the children.

He mentions lack of capital and competition for the local market as his major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nail Indah 1 Group

texts.en:
Nani, 50 years old, still has two children in school: 12-year-old Anggi and 15-year-old Raka. Her business is selling exercise books, notebooks, clothes and watches, if any orders come from her friends. She has already run this business for five years. She does not make a lot of profit from the sale of her books and sometimes she gives four or five books free to pupils who cannot afford them.

Nani will use this loan to buy notebooks and exercise books. She has a plan to have a bookstore and open a noodle shop. She is excited about her business, because she can help out poor pupils and run this business as her hobby.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and exercise books to sell to pupils

loans.name: Emm's Group

texts.en:
Emm is a villager of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. As the 36-year-old mother of two children who need her care as they are still in school, she has been engaged in rice farming and cassava planting. From the current business, which she has been in for 15 years, she can earn about 32,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
 
Emm's group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan has helped Emm to better support her family, as well as her children in school. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land. She hopes to get a high yield from her farming business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Víctor no pudo estudiar una carrea profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, ya que su familia era muy humilde, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Vino para engreírlo, ya que este es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Víctor trabaja como obrero en una empresa de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa deportiva por pedido, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque tiene buenos clientes que siempre acuden a él.
Víctor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como ropa deportiva, tanto para damas y caballeros, de esta manea tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio; así pues Víctor seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y espera poder lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia para poder vivir con su esposa y formar su propia familia.
texts.en: Victor is 41 years old and lives in the city of Nazca with his wife.  He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire for improvement.  Unfortunately Victor was unable to study for a professional career as he would have liked.  This is because he had to work from a very young age to help his parents, as his family was very poor.  In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends, and sometimes his wife cooks a delicious chicken with wine to spoil him, as this is his favorite dish.  On his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Victor works as a laborer for a company in his city. He also has a small business selling sports clothing  by order.  He works every day from very early in the morning and can work for about 12 hours.  He enjoys working and believes that it is going well because he has good customers who always turn to him.  Victor is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because due to the help provided he will be able to buy merchandise, such as sports clothing for women and men.  In this way his business will be better supplied, and Victor can continue working and trying to get ahead.  He hopes to achieve his great dream of owning his own house, where he can live with his wife and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy sports clothing to sell.

loans.name: Juana Benita

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 34 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Juana no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por la calidad de sus productos y por las facilidades de pago que les brinda a sus clientes.
Juana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, tales como prendas de vestir de la estación de verano, sandalias, entre otros; así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propi y espera convertirse en una empresaria de éxito.
texts.en:
Juana is a 34 year old single woman who lives in Chincha.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enterprising person with a great desire to succeed.  Unfortunately Juana was not able to study for a professional career because she had to go to work when she was very young in order to help her parents financially.  She would have liked to have liked to study.  She likes to watch television in her spare time and on occasion likes to cook a delicious rice and duck dish to share with her family.

Juana works in her small clothing sales business with great enthusiasm.  She sells clothing and shoes for men, women, and children and works daily from early morning for up to eight hours.  She feels comfortable doing her work and believes that things are going well for her because of the quality of the products she and ease of payment she offers her customers.  

Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise, such as summer seasonal clothing, sandals, and other things to stock her business.  She will continue to work hard to get ahead and achieve her dream of having a home of her own and having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Samir Johan

texts.es:
Samir es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su madre, Samir pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Turismo, la cual le sirve de mucho en su trabajo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Samir trabaja como Guía de Turismo en un hotel de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 9 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el conocimiento que poses y por su experiencia.
Samir se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del tratamiento médico que necesita su madre, ya que ella se encuentra muy delicada de salud, de esta manera Samir espera poder aliviar las dolencias de su madre y mejorar su salud, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y así poder lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia en el centro de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Samir is 21 years old, single, and lives in Nazca with his parents and brothers.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to succeed.  Thanks to his effort and support from his mother, Samir was able to study a tourism career, which helps him greatly.  In his free time he likes to relax, listening to music and at times prepare a delicious “Seco de Res” dish to share with his family.

Samir works as a tourist guide in a hotel in the city.  He works every day from early morning and can work for about 9 hours.  He feels comfortable doing this work and believes that things are going well for him because of his knowledge and experience.

Samir is very grateful to Kiva and thanks to the assistance, he will be able to cover his mother’s medical expenses; her health is fragile.  In this way Samir hopes to relieve his mother’s pain and improve her health.  He will continue to work hard to get ahead and be able to achieve his great dream of having a home of his own in the center of town.

loans.use: to  cover his mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Lindaura Ventura

texts.es:
Lindaura es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Lindaura no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, ya que eran una familia muy humilde, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Saltado de Brocoli, el cual es el plato favorito de su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lindaura trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, ella cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, el cual utiliza para atender a sus clientes, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Lindaura se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el tarrajeo, pintado y la puesta de un piso de concreto en la parte delantera de su vivienda, ya que ahí acondicionará un pequeño espacio para su negocio de venta de comida, de esta manera podrá atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose con el deseo de poder lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lindaura, 46, lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and three beloved children, who are her reason for living. She is a likable, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman; she and her husband put all their efforts into helping their family get ahead. Sadly, Lindaura wasn´t able to study a for a career because she had to support her parents and her modest family; however, she would have liked to pursue her studies. She likes listening to music in her free time, and occasionally she makes her family´s favorite dish, the delicious "saltado de brocoli."

On her own initiative and with dedication and effort, Lindaura works at her small food stand every day from early morning for about six hours. The stand occupies a small space in her house where she serves cutomers. She likes her work and believes it is successful because she treats her customers well and her food tastes good. 

Lindaura thanks the Kiva lenders whose support will allow her to plaster, paint, and install a concrete floor in the patio of her home. She will air condition a small space for her food business so that her customers are more comfortable. She will keep working and trying to achieve her dream to finish her house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Lisseth Giovanna

texts.es:
Lisseth es una mujer de 30 años, es soltera,  vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus Padres y su hermana menor, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora  entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Lisseth no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar una pequeña carrera técnica de corte y confección, la cual le ha servido de mucho. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace dos años Lisseth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección y costura de ropa, adicionalmente también trabaja vendiendo pollos, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana  y puede hacerlo por  un aproximado de 8 horas, ella cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Lisseth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña maquina remalladora semi industrial; de esta manera Lisseth podrá realizar todo tipo de costuras, con ello espera poder aumentar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ir logrando su sueño de terminar la construcción de su casa y espera poder seguir ayudando a su hermana menor para que se convierta en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Lisseth is 30, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and younger sister, whom she loves and are her principal reason for living. She is likable, hardworking, and enthusiastic and wants to get ahead. Sadly, Lisseth couldn´t study for a career, but thanks to hard work, she was able to complete a technical course in cutting and sewing that has been a great help. 

On her own initiative and with dedication and effort, Lisseth works at her sewing business every day for up to 8 hours starting early in the morning. She also sells chickens and feels her businesses are a success because she is dedicated and treats her customers well.

Lisseth thanks the Kiva lenders whose support will allow her to buy a small, commercial overlock sewing machine that can be used for all kinds of stitching. She expects that this investment will increase her business and income. She will be able to slowly achieve her goals to finish her house and continue helping her younger sister so that she can have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, María no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su Madres, María trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja en un pequeño puesto alquilado en un mercado de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana, ella vende prendas de vestir tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, María puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un mostrador y  prendas de vestir de la temporadas para poder acondicionar y abastecer mejor su negocio, de esta manera María seguirá trabajando y esforzando se para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de poder tener su propio local de ventas y poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Maria is a 21 year old single woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and brothers.  She is a friendly hardworking and enthusiastic young woman with a great desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately she was not able to finish her studies because of lack of financial resources and because she had to begin working very young to help her parents.  Maria was not able to study management but she would have liked to.  In her free time she like playing sports and sometimes likes to cook a delicious Chicken Cau Cau to share with her family.

Maria works her small business, selling clothing with dedication and support from her mother.  She has a small rented stall in the city market and works every day beginning early in the morning and can work for up to 12 hours.  She sells articles of clothing for men, women, and children and believes that things are going well for her because of the good treatment she provides her employees.

Maria is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because they have allowed her to buy a display case and seasonal clothing so that she can set up and stock her business.  In this way Maria will continue to work toward her dreams of getting ahead, having her own shop, and studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a display case and merchandise.

loans.name: Luz Perla

texts.es:
Luz es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pequeño hijo de pocos meses de nación, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que es para y madre para él; lamentablemente Luz no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, ya que su familia es muy humilde, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta visitar a su familia y en algunas de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pescado Frito para compartir con ellos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luz trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pescado, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 7 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por sus buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como madera, calaminas y clavos, de esta manera Luz podrá terminar la construcción del techado de su vivienda, con ello espera poder podrá brindarle mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues Luz seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder darle una buena educación a su pequeño y en un futuro no muy lejano desea verlo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Luz is 20 years old. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her little son born a few months ago. She is a very kind person, hardworking and enthusiastic, who puts all her efforts into raising her child, as she is his mother for him. Unfortunately Luz was not able to finish her primary school studies, since from a very young child she had to work to help her parents. Her family is humble, but she would have liked very much to study for a professional career in education. In her free time she likes to visit her family and sometimes on these occasions to cook delicious fried fish to share with them.

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Luz works in her own small business selling fish. She works every day from early in the morning and can work for approximately 7 hours. She feels happy doing her work and believes that it is going well because of her good prices and the kind service she offers her customers.

Luz is very grateful for the Kiva loans as thanks to the support given she she can buy construction materials, such as wood, corrugated zinc roofing, and nails. This will allow Luz to finish the construction of the roof of her house, as she is hoping to be able to offer better security and wellbeing for her family. So Luz will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of being able to give a good education to her child and in the not so far off future see him become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as wood, corrugated zinc roofing and nails, in order to complete the construction of the roof of her house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 7 años, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Elizabeth no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado, en sus ratos libres le pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Elizabeth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas y gaseosas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Elizabeth se siente muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para la tramitación y formalización de un pequeño terreno, el cual compró hace poco y en el que pronto iniciará la construcción de su propia vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su pequeño convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 36, lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and her 7-year-old son. She loves them very much and they are her reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, puts all her effort into moving her family forward. Unfortunately, Elizabeth was unable to finish secondary school, because from the time she was young she had to work to help her parents with household expenses. But she would have liked to stud secretarial work. In her free time, she likes to walk through the warm and welcoming streets of her city and sometimes she makes a delicious chicken and rice dish to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, she works in her small business selling beauty products. She also has a small business selling candies and soft drinks. She works every day, from very early in the morning and she can work for about 10 hours. She likes her work and she believes that it is going well for her because of her good prices and the friendly way she treats her customers. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to them, she will be able to cover the expenses of the processing and formalization of the title to a small plot of land, which she bought a little while ago, and on which she will soon start building her own home. She will keep working and making an effort to achieve her great dream of seeing her son become a professional.

loans.use: to cover expenses for the processing and formalization of the title to her land.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As Linda is underage, her mother Carmen is taking out this Kiva loan to grow their business. 

Linda is only 16 years old, but her life is already extraordinary. Originally from Colombia, Linda spent seven years in foster care before she joined her new family in the United States three years ago. Her adoptive mom, Carmen, already had seven children of her own before she decided to welcome Linda and her two sisters to the family. 

As if adjusting to a new country, culture and family is not stressful enough to a teenager, Linda was diagnosed with a life threatening disease in 2011. She went through various treatments and lost her beautiful long hair.

While having to endure many long days in the hospital, her mother brought her jewelry making materials to keep her busy.  Linda always had a deep love for jewelry. She discovered her passion and talent during her cancer treatment, resulting in the production of beautiful earrings, necklaces and bracelets. Her first sale took place from the hospital bed, when one of the nurses purchased earrings from her for his mother. From that point, Linda has grown her business without even noticing that she had started one. More nurses and doctors came by her bedside to purchase her designs and the word spread among family and friends.

In August 2012, the Make-A-Wish Foundation granted Linda’s wish to meet and be mentored by her role model Ivanka Trump, jewelry designer, model and business woman. Read about it here: http://bit.ly/TQewDv. 

Their $6,000 loan will be used for marketing and to buy supplies and packaging material. 

Linda’s jewelry can be purchased from her website: www.LindaDesigns4U.com

video.title: Kiva Borrower Carmen & Linda from United States

loans.use: to pay for marketing and supplies for her daughter's jewelry business

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa is 54 years old and lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children.
 
Villa has a dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to add capital for her dried fish vending business.
 
Villa has been a member of PMPC for one year. Villa hopes to have more savings, in the future.

loans.use: to add capital for her dried fish vending business.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 54 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Epifania sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to add capital to her business. 

In the future, Epifania hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to add a capital in her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 36 years old and is married with three children. They presently reside in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor in the Philippines.

She has engaged in this business for almost seven months and earns three thousand pesos ( PHP 3,000.00) as her monthly net income.

She had been a new member of PMPC for less than a year, but she hopes to expand her business with the help of this institution. She has requested a loan amount of PHP 3,000.00 to purchase feed for her swine raising business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for swine raising

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is into gari production. Gari is made out of cassava. Abena sells the gari at Akonoma near Cape Coast, which she has done for some years now. She is married to an auto electrician and has two children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. Abena will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase cassava to produce gari to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi produces kenkey for sale (kenkey is an African dish made out of maize). Esi has been in this business for some time now.  Esi lives together with her three children at Akonma near Cape Coast  She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Esi will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale. With the new profit, Esi plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells maize porridge. She lives together with her 4 children in Nyame Bekyere. Ekua has been selling maize porridge for 4 years now. She uses her income to feed and clothe their children.

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale. With the new profit, Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale

loans.name: Efrain Rodolfo

texts.es:
EFRAIN RODOLFO tiene 29 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central. esta ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina conformada por 16 socios que son de la misma comunidad.

EFRAIN RODOLFO  es empleado público, además se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, balanceado, vacunas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales para mejorar los ingresos.
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda cada semana. El sueño es tener una casa para vivir cómiçodo con los padres.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los sueldos bajos es por ello que ve la necesidad de buscar otros ingresos.
En el timepo libre le gusta jugar boly y disfrutardec las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en: Efraín Rodolfo, 29, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  He’s a member of the “Cuatro Esquinas Central” communal bank located 20 minutes from the office; it has 16 members who are from the same community.  Efraín Rodolfo is a public employee but also works buying and selling chickens.  He’s requesting the loan to buy chicks, feed and vaccines.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy the animals to improve his income.  He makes his purchases weekly in Guaranda and his dream is to have a house to live comfortably in with his parents.  The challenge he faces is low salary which is why he has to find other sources of income.  He likes playing volleyball in his free time and to enjoy the festivities during Carnival.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has two children. She is 55 years old and lives in Lower Lamac in Oroquieta City.
Gloria engages in buying and selling to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP for additional capital for her buying and selling business.
Gloria has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Gloria hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy additional capital.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is widowed and has three children. She is 64 years old, and lives in the Philippines.
Josefa is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to be used as additional capital in her existing business.
Josefa has been a member of PMPC for more than two years. In the future, she hopes to have a very well-known flower shop and to export her flowers to different areas.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her flower business.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is married with five children. She is 55 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Annabel sells food as her business. She has had this business for 29 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 4,800. Annabel has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.


In the future, Annabel hopes to purchase home appliances and have savings to be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for pawned ricefield.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 49-year-old widow, who has five children who support her needs. She presently resides at Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor.

She has engaged in hog raising for five years, and the business helps her to earn more of her living. She requested a loan amount of PHP 3,000, which she will use as additional capital for hog raising.

She is a new member of PMPC and hopes to be successful in her business in the future.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 45 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married and has two children.

Leonora is a dressmaker and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 9000 for additional capital.
Leonora has been a member of PMPC since this year, 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: for additional capital

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa is married and has five children. She is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Crisologa sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and had this business for six years. She has requested a loan to use as additional capital in her fruits and vegetables business.
Crisologa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Crisologa hopes to have a larger vegetable and fruits store business and to sell a different variety of products.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her existing business.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: La señora Delicia, es una persona de 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltera pero vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, y cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, produce papa, haba y maíz en sus propios terrenos, de las cuales una parte cuenta con riego por inundación y otras son temporales; que se hallan situadas en las comunidades de Iluri Grande y Cochimita del municipio de Tíraque que esta distante a unos 78 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Delicia y su familia manifiestan ser personas trabajadores y responsables que quieren superarse y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de terreno agrícola que a futuro les permitirá obtener mayor producción y de tal forma obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Señora Delicia is 24 years old. She is unmarried but lives with her partner. She reached primary level in school, and she has three economic dependents in her care, her three little children. The business in which she works is agricultural production. She produces potatoes, beans, and corn on her own land, of which one part has flood irrigation and the others have seasonal irrigation. Her land is located in the communities of Iluri Grande and Cochimita, in the municipality of Tiraque, which is some 78 km from the city of Cochabamba. Señora Delicia and her family demonstrate that they are hard-working and responsible people who want to better themselves, and to that end they see the need to apply for capital to invest in the purchase of agricultural land that in the future will allow them to obtain greater production and in this way obtain greater income, which will improve the quality of life of their dependents.

loans.use: to buy farm land

loans.name: Benedito

texts.es: Benedito de 47 años, es un hombre emprendedor y soñador. Vive junto a su conviviente Silvia, quien es su socia en su actividad laboral. Tienen una  casa propia donde crían a sus 3 Hijos, quienes están en etapa escolar. El trabajo de Benedito consiste en labrar la tierra, fertilizarla para sembrar cítricos tales como limón, naranja, mandarina. Después de la siembra se dedica a regar y cuidar las  plantas de las distintas plagas que atacan esta especie. El lugar donde realiza esta actividad se encuentra  a un kilómetro de su vivienda. Se inició en esta actividad con ayuda de  su suegra y luego compró unas hectáreas de terrenos para realizar sus  propios cultivos. Cuando llega el tiempo de la cosecha, los obreros que contrata eventualmente se dedican a coger para luego seleccionar los cítricos para los distintos mercados. Comenta que es rentable su  trabajo ya que   en este tiempo  los cítricos tienen un buen precio en el mercado porque son muy solicitados por los clientes. Al iniciar  su labor tuvo  dificultades  para  comprar abono y fertilizantes que necesitaba porque no contaba con le capital necesario para adquirir estos productos esenciales. Pero obtuvo un pequeño  préstamo  y fue su impulso  para seguir adelante. Espera crecer en su negocio y obtener  más hectáreas de terreno para una mejor distribución de sus parcelas. Por tanto éste será su préstamo numero 20 con la institución MFP, tiene ganas de seguir siendo socio; seguir siendo puntual. Sabe que lo socios de su grupo son responsables  por que los conoce muchos años. Además agradece a la institución  por brindarle la oportunidad de contar con un capital para seguir en su ardua labor. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará abono, fertilizantes y pagara unos obreros porque falta  pocas semanas para la cosecha la cual es abundante.
texts.en:
Benedito is forty-seven years old and is a hard-working man and a dreamer.  He lives with his life partner Silvia, who is also his work partner.  They have their own home where they raise their three children, all of which are in school.  Benedito's work involves plowing the land and laying fertilizer in order to plant different citrus trees, like lemon, orange, and mandarin.  After planting the seeds, he works to water and care for the plants, protecting them from different pests that attack these specific plant types.  

The place where he works is a kilometer from his home.  He began this activity with the help of his mother-in-law.  He later bought some plots of land in order to grow his own crops.  When the harvest time arrives, the workers that he hires gather and select the citrus fruits for the different markets.  He says that his work is profitable; citrus fruits already have a good price at the market this season because they are in high demand.    

At first, he had trouble buying the manure and fertilizers he needed for his work because he did not have the necessary capital to purchase these essential products.  However, he obtained a small loan and this was his boost to continue moving forward.  He hopes to grow his business and to obtain more plots of land in order to better distribute his crops.  

This will be his twentieth loan with MFP.  He has hopes of continuing to be a member and to continue making his payments on time.  He knows that his group members are responsible, since he has known them for many years.  He is also thankful to the institution for offering him the opportunity to count on capital in order to continue his work.  

With the amount he is requesting (1000), he will buy manure, fertilizer, and will pay the laborers, since there are only a few weeks left before the abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Nefilia

texts.en:
Nefilia is 61 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married and has five children.

To earn a living, Nefilia has a business selling a variety of products. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this work. 

Nefilia has requested a loan of 9,000 for additional capital.

Nefilia has been a member of PMPC for this year. In the future, Nefilia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: for additional capital/ to purchase liquor, cigarettes and other products to retail

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 27-year-old man. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a motorcycle which he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located within a busy town and his primary customers are residents from the environs and tourists. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within his area of operation.

He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle to increase transportation services to customers so as to meet their demands. His business goal is to own at least three motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Las Muchachitas Del Ranchito Group

texts.es:
GRUPO LAS MUCHACHITAS DEL RANCHITO ESTA INTEGRADO POR 5 MUJERES COMERCIANTES ELLAS SON VECINAS DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS,SE CONOCEN MUY BIEN Y SE DAN LA MANO UNAS CON OTRAS YA QUE EL LUGAR DONDE VIVEN ES MUY HUMILDE Y TODAS DESEAN SALIR ADELANTE Y MEJORAR SU COMUNIDAD. SUS NOMBRES SON CECILIA,MARTHA,SARA.YUVI Y TERESA.
HOY HABLAREMOS DE SARA, ELLA TIENE 33 AÑOS VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON SU PAREJA,TIENE 3 HIJOS QUE ESTUDIAN PRIMARIA Y SECUNDARIA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CALZADO,PARA GANAR UN DINERO EXTRA Y PODER AYUDAR A SU PAREJA CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR Y LA ESCUELA DE SUS HIJOS. ELLA UTILIZARA SU CREDITO PARA SURTIR CALZADO SE TEMPORADA INVERNAL, Y PODER TENER UNA BUENA VENTA EN ESTOS MESES DE INVIERNO.
EL SUEÑO DE MARTHA ES LLEGAR A TENER UNA ZAPATERIA EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD Y ASI INCRREMANTAR LAS VENTAS YA QUE ELLA QUIERE QUE SUS HIJOS TERMINEN LA ESCUELA Y SEAN PROFESIONISTAS.
texts.en:
Las Muchachitas Del Ranchito Group comprises five female merchants. They have been neighbors for several years and know each other very well. They help each other out, since they live in a very humble place and they all want to get ahead and improve their community. Their names are Cecilia, Martha, Sara, Yuvi, and Teresa.

Today we will talk about Sara. She is 33 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her partner and has three children who are in elementary and middle school. She works selling shoes in order to make some extra money so that she can help her partner with household expenses and to pay for their children's school. She will use her loan to stock up on shoes for the winter season so that she can make good sales during the winter months.

Martha's dream is to one day have a shoe shop downtown so that she can increase her sales, because she wants her children to finish school and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy winter shoes.

loans.name: Grupo El Ranchito Group

texts.es:
GRUPO EL RANCHITO ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO,ESTA INTEGRADO POR 5 MUJERES COMERCIANTES VIVEN EN LA MISMA COLONIA SE CONOCEN DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS,LA MAYORIA DE ELLAS VENDE EN LOS MERCADOS RODANTES OTRAS EN SU DOMICILIO. SUS NOMBRES SON CELIA,CLAUDIA,GRISELDA,JOSEFINA Y MARIA DEL ROSARIO.
EN ESTA OCACION HABLAREMOS DE JOSEFINA, VENDE ROPA EN LOS MERCADOS RODANTES ES CASADA,TIENE 38 AÑOS Y TIENE 3 HIJOS QUE ESTUDIAN PRIMARIA Y SECUNDARIA, ELLA UTILIZARA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRAR,ROPA DE TEMPORADA DE INVIERNO YA QUE TIENE MUY POCO INVENTARIO. EL SUEÑO DE JOSEFINA ES TENER UN LOCAL, EN UNA AVENIDA GRANDE CERCA DE SU CASA Y TENER VENTA DE ROPA,PARA TODA LA FAMILIA Y ASI TENER MAYORES INGRESOS PARA QUE SUS HIJOS PUEDAN TERMINAR SUS ESTUDIOS,Y DARLES UNA VIDA MEJOR.
texts.en:
The “El Ranchito” group is a Credituyo communal bank with five female members who are merchants and live in the same neighborhood; they’ve known each other for several years and most of them sell in movable street markets or from home.  They are Celia, Claudia, Griselda, Josefina and María del Rosario.

On this occasion, Josefina will be featured.  She sells clothes in movable street markets.  She’s married and is 38-years-old.  She has three children attending primary and secondary school.  She will use the loan to buy winter clothes because her inventory is low.  Josefina’s dream is to have a store on a main avenue near her house to sell clothes for the entire family and thus earn higher income so that her children can finish their schooling and to give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 50 años, casada tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 27, 23, 15 y 10 años,   ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo,  es promotora,  ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Juana va a usar este préstamo  para comprar zapatos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio ya que esta época de fin año su demanda se incrementa ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Juana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old, is married and has four children aged 10, 15, 23 and 27. She sells shoes by catalogue and is a promoter. She sells as a travelling saleswoman visiting public and private institutions and homes in various neighborhoods offering her products. 

This loan is her first sequence with the institution. Juana is going to use this loan to buy shoes that are on sale to have them in stock for her business since during this end of year period her demands increase and she already has many orders to deliver. Her reason for requesting this loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy her customers. 

Juana faces challenges in her business which are to serve her customers with efficiency. She is going to use the profits to improve the quality of life of her family since this is the only business that allows her to support herself and support her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes which are on sale to have them in stock.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es muy conocida en su lugar de vivienda ya que desde muy pequeño ha residido  ahí, vive junto a su esposa e hijos quienes le ayudan con el negocio. Él se dedica a la siembra de  maíz y frijoles, un negocio muy rentable en su lugar de vivienda, ya que cuenta con varios clientes quienes siempre compran sus productos. Mercedes es muy responsable y trabajador con deseos de mejorar su trabajo, él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para comprar insumos para realizar la limpia a los frijoles ya cultivados, y debido a que la cantidad es bastante grande también invertirá en mano de obra para realizar esta actividad. Con esto Mercedes logrará sacar su trabajo más rápido lo cual lo beneficiará mucho y así mismo beneficiará a otras personas brindándoles empleo temporal.
texts.en: Mercedes is very well known in the place where he lives, since he has lived there since he was very young. He lives with his wife and children, who help him with the business. He plants corn and beans, a very profitable business in the area where he lives, since he has a number of customers who always buy his products. Mercedes is very responsible and hard working, with the desire to improve his work. He is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to pay for the supplies to clean the beans that are already planted, and since the amount is big enough, he will also invest in labor to do this. With this Mercedes will be able to do this work more rapidly, which will help him a lot, and at the same time it will benefit other people by offering them seasonal employment.

loans.use: pay for labor to clean his beans

loans.name: Siliai

texts.en:
Siliai is a 42-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She has a small business growing vegetables such as tomatoes, beans, cucumbers and cabbages in her garden.

She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house so her family can have better living conditions. Siliai will use the loan to buy iron roofing, timber and cement for the house. Siliai joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy iron roofing, timber and cement for the house

loans.name: Seupue

texts.en:
Seupue is a 19-year-old single lady with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu and banana, which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Seupue needs a loan to buy equipment such as a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, a spade and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Seupue will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to expand her business .

loans.use: to buy equipment such as a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, a spade and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Asitu

texts.en: Asitu sells cooking oil at Abura. She is married. Asitu has been selling footwear for three years now.  She uses her income to help her husband pay   their accommodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase gallons of cooking oil to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footwear.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert works for RESTIO ENERGY, a Barefoot Power distributor in South Africa. 

This is his story: 

RESTIO ENERGY Company is a registered company and a leading energy for development consultancy, based in Somerset West, South Africa. The company was founded in 2001 and has since led and participated in numerous consultancy and project development initiatives across the SACD and East African region. Our focus has been on understanding energy poverty and developing sustainable solutions to address these realities. We work principally in the ‘off-grid’ and ‘low-income’ sector covering the fields of renewable energy and liquid fuels for both electric power and thermal energy in order to provide these communities with access to an integrated and sustainable energy solution.

RESTIO ENERGY was set up by Robert, who is the founder. He is a leading development consultant in the African renewable energy industry with specializations in sustainable energy service business models, the productive use of renewable energy, energy and development programme evaluations and energy project feasibility studies. Robert has worked with a host of development organizations, including the World Bank, United Nations, Millennium Challenge Account, GVEP-I and GIZ. He holds an MSc degree in Environmental Change and Management from the Environmental Change Institute at Oxford University, as well as a Master of Social Science degree in Social Anthropology. He also serves on the Consumer Working Group of the Global Cook Stove Alliance.

The need for affordable and clean energy among the South Africans not connected to the grid in the townships was the idea behind starting this organization--more so our commitment to promoting original, financially sustainable and accessible solutions to a range of energy-related problems and challenges. We understand that energy is an essential element in achieving sustainable development and we aim to understand and address the obstacles impeding the successful delivery. We focus on a broad range of market opportunities, from working with those facing energy poverty to more mainstream opportunities in commercial, agricultural and industrial arenas. Working with a client profile including private, public and non-governmental organizations, we develop, promote and distribute energy solutions that inform, present income generating opportunities, and offer convenience and value for money.  

We aim to reduce the use of candles and paraffin lanterns, which will in turn reduce accidental fires as well as accidental ingestion of paraffin. We also believe that current illumination options, in addition to the dangers, are more expensive in the long-run than Barefoot Power products. Importantly, the presence and use of Barefoot Power products within these rural households will provide an invaluable demonstration of the effectiveness and performance of PV-based lighting products in communities where such products currently have very little traction. This will be used to further stimulate the demand for these products.

The loan will be used toward the cost of procurement of 1,800 Firefly Mobile Lamps from Barefoot Power. This will assist with the cash flow requirements for the purchase and distribution of the Firefly Mobile Lamps to individuals and communities in six provinces in South Africa, supported by a government contract through the Department of Rural Development and Land Reform (DRDLR). Through it we will be in a position to reach 1,700 people in remote areas through a coordinated formal distribution as dictated by the DRDLR.

In order for the Firefly Mobile Lamps to become increasingly accessible to all markets, we require economies of scale, so the more people who benefit from the use thereof, the more this will contribute to Restio building a sustainable mode of distribution in order to grow the market.

Important information
Working with Barefoot Power has always felt like a partnership. Through collaborative efforts to build the market, Barefoot Power and Restio have worked together to promote the use of solar at conferences and workshops and share the vision of improving access to renewable and clean energy solutions through solar product distribution.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Robert from South Africa

loans.use: To buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru: Александр имеет 2 торговые точки, которые расположены одна на рынке, а вторая – в магазине «Лавинс». Александр торгует одеждой и аксессуарами. Дополнительные средства понадобились для закупки зимних шапок, шарфов, а так же ремней.
texts.en: Alexander operates 2 retail spots, one of which is located at a market and the other within the Lovins store. Alexander sells clothing and accessories. He presently needs additional funds to stock up on winter hats and scarves, as well as belts.

loans.use: to buy belts and winter hats and scarves

loans.name: Houenoussou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement HOUENOUSSOU 1 est formé de onze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Élisabeth, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Élisabeth est âgée de 39 ans et mariée à un certain Thomas. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Il y a plusieurs années que Élisabeth mène comme activité la vente des ustensiles de cuisines et des produits divers à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Élisabeth s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Élisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU 1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Houenoussou 1 Group is made up of eleven people who all live in the same neighbourhood and run complementary businesses.  The representative of the group, Élisabeth, is 39-years-old and married to a man named Thomas.  The couple has six children who are all in school, of whom two remain dependents. The couple work together to provide for the various household expenses.  The children live together with their parents. 

For many years, Élisabeth has been doing business selling kitchen utensils and various other products from her home through a distribution system.  Élisabeth buys her stock at a market in Bénin.  This is the third time that she has asked for a loan along with the other members of the Houenoussou 1 Group via ALIDé.  The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and other products.

loans.name: Houenoussou 2 Group

texts.fr: HOUENOUSSOU 2 est un groupement de treize personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans un même quartier et mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante du groupe, Victoire (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Isidore. Victoire est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Victoire vend depuis plusieurs années, des ustensiles de cuisine et divers produits par le système de distribution. Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Victoire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU 2 un troisième financement auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Houenoussou 2 is a group made up of thirteen people, all of whom live together in the same neighbourhood and run complementary businesses.  The representative of the group, Victoire (with her hand raised in the photo) is married to a man named Isidore.  Victoire is 34 years old, and lives in Bénin.  The couple has four children, all of whom are in school and two remain dependents.  Victoire lives together with her husband and children.  The couple both work to provide for the various family expenses together.

To this end, Victoire has for a long time been selling kitchen utensils as well as other products through a distribution system.  Victoire buys her stock at a market in Bénin.  With the goal being to reinforce her business and to satisfy the demands of her clientele, Victoire, along with the other members of the Houenoussou 2 Group, is asking for a third loan via ALIDé.  The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and other products.

loans.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma se dedica a la venta de comidas, desde hace mas de 7 años, tiene una hija de 19 años, ella le ayuda en la venta de comida. Norma utilizara su crédito, para comprar utensilios y materia prima, que le permita tener mayor variedad de alimentos,que le demandan sus clientes.
el sueño de Norma es llegar a tener un local, de comidas mas grande en el centro de la ciudad.ya que donde vende actualmente es un espacio muy pequeño.Norma acudió a nuestra ayuda, para así poder incrementar sus ventas y en un futuro hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en: Norma has been selling food for more than 7 years.  She has a 19-year-old daughter who helps her sell the food.  Norma will use her loan to buy utensils and raw materials to have a wider variety of food her customers are requesting.  Norma’s dream is to acquire a larger food place downtown because where she sells now is too small.  Norma requested help to increase sales and in future make her dream reality.

loans.use: to buy utensils.

loans.name: Kakone Traders Group

texts.en: Joseph is a sixty-two-year-old married man with fifteen children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling fish for thirteen years and works six days a week and also has a salt business as an additional income source. Bad weather and inadequate capital are his challenges while his dreams are to start processing salt as he currently sells it in its original form direct from the lake. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy salt pans. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy salt pans.

loans.name: Zapata Group

texts.es:
Zapata es un grupo solidario de  Credituyo desde hace varios ciclos, esta integrado por cinco mujeres comerciantes, sus nombres son: Elda, Josefina, Maria del Consuelo, Margarita y Martha. Viven en la misma comunidad.  Se entienden muy bien entre ellas mismas ya que todas son muy entusiastas, y quieren salir adelante, es por eso que acudieron a nuestra ayuda para hacer crecer su negocio.
Josefina es una de las integrantes, tiene ya 63 años de edad y ella se dedica ala venta de tacos al vapor (un plato regional del estado de Nuevo león) desdé hace mas de 12 años. Es casada, con dos hijos mayores de edad, ella  utilizará su crédito para comprar un carrito (triciclo) para poner otro punto de venta y así hacer crecer su negocio, ella inició la venta con un solo carrito, pero con nuestra ayuda ya cuenta con 3 carritos mas y este sería el cuarto.
El sueño de Josefina es llegar a tener varios puestos de comida, con empleados y que sus hijos sean los encargados del negocio y así asegurar su futuro tranquilo y sin preocupaciones de dinero.
texts.en:
“Zapata” has been a Credituyo communal bank for several cycles.  It has five women who are merchants.  Their names are: Elda, Josefina, María del Consuelo, Margarita and Martha.  They live in the same community and get along with each other very well because they are all very enthusiastic and want to get ahead.  This is why they approached the institution for help to make their businesses grow.

Josefina is one of the group members.  She’s already 63-years-old and has been working selling steamed tacos (a regional dish from the state of Nuevo León) for 12 years.  She’s married and has two adult children.  She will use the loan to buy a cart (three-wheeled) to set up an additional sales point and make her business grow this way.  She started her sales with single cart and now thanks to support from the institution she has three more; this one would be her fourth.

Josefina’s dream is to have several food stands with employees and that her children run the business thus insuring a secure future for them that’s free from money worries.

loans.use: to buy a taco cart.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья продает вещи бывшие в употреблении (second hand) на рынке в г. Виноградово. Лучше всего продаются детские вещи. Наталья работает сама - сама делает закупки, сама продает, сама разкладывает и собирает свое торговое место. Расходы минимальные - Наталья оплачивает только за место на рынке, - позволяют больше средств оставлять на развитие бизнеса. Самое трудное было начать бизнес; сейчас - все более менее налажено. Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит, чтобы закупить женскую и мужскую зимнюю верхнюю одежду для продажи. В будущем Наталья планирует торговать еще обувью.
texts.en: Natalya sells second-hand goods at a market in the city of  Vinogradovo.  Children's clothes are her best-selling items.  Natalya works by herself: she buys and sells her merchandise alone, she prepares her retail space and displays her goods alone.  Her costs are minimal since she only has to pay for her market space.  This allows her to reinvest more money into her business.  The most difficult part was to start her business.  Now she is more or less established.  Natalya is requesting a loan to buy women's and men's outdoor clothing for the winter, which she will then resell.  In the future, she would like to add shoes to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's outdoor clothes for the winter.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JORGE  VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y  SU HIJO, DESDE HACE AÑOS RADICAN EN EL TRÓPICO DE COCHABAMBA, EN LA COMUNIDAD DE BULO BULO DEL MUNICIPIO DE ENTRE RÍOS, DESDE 11 AÑOS. EL CLIENTE ES DE LA PROVINCIA YAPACANI  DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE SANTA CRUZ, UNO DE LOS LUGARES MAS POBRES DE BOLIVIA, VINO DE SU COMUNIDAD DE ICHILO COMO LA MAYORÍA DE LAS PERSONAS BUSCANDO MAYOR OPORTUNIDAD DE VIDA, EN SU COMUNIDAD LA PRODUCCIÓN BAJO DEBIDO A LOS CAMBIOS CLIMATOLÓGICOS, DIFÍCIL DE CONTROLAR, CADA VES LA PRODUCCIÓN ESCASO, POR LO QUE DECIDIÓ IR AL TRÓPICO, PERO CON EL TRASCURSO DEL TIEMPO, CON MUCHO TRABAJO Y ESFUERZO SE COMPRO SU LOTE AGRÍCOLA, EN LA QUE HOY EN DÍA TRABAJA EN EL SECTOR AGRICOLA. EL CRÉDITO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO ES PARA MANTENIMIENTO DE  PLÁTANO, DE ESTA MANERA PODRÁ MEJORAR SU NIVEL DE VIDA TAMBIÉN SU SEÑORA SIEMPRE A ESTADO COLABORANDO EN SUS ACTIVIDADES.
texts.en: Señor Jorge lives with his wife and his son. Eleven years ago they settled in the Cochabamba Tropics region, in the community of Bulo Bulo in the Entre Rios township. He is from the Yapacani province in the Santa Cruz department, one of the poorest areas of Bolivia. He left his community of Ichilo like the majority of the people seeking better opportunities in life. In his community, the low production due the climate changes was difficult to control. Every time, the production decreased, so he decided to go to the Tropics region; but in the course of time, and with much work and effort, he bought his agricultural plot, where today he works in the agricultural sector. The loan that he is applying for is to maintain his banana planting. In this way he will be able to improve his standard of living. In addition, his wife always contributes to their work.

loans.use: to maintain his banana plantings

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business, selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling kitchen wares and ready-to-wear clothes. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF, to buy additional empty three-gallon bottles, which she will refill with purified drinking water to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional empty three-gallon bottles, which she will refill with purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a hardworking man aged 41 years. He is married with four children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a textile shop specializing in clothes and shoes, which he has done for five years. He got capital from the sale of piece of land given by his father with the sole aim of being self-employed since unemployment is a great challenge in Uganda.

Vincent is doing well in his business and is able to pay school fees for his three children. His business is situated along a busy highway thus attracting more customers. He has a plan of constructing rental houses to boost his income further despite challenges of inflation. Vincent is requesting a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis  is single and has no children. She is a Junior High School leaver. She is a hair dresser and sells biscuits and other juvenile products like balloons and toys at Whindo near Takoradi.  For the past year she has been in this venture. As part of her responsibilities, Mavis uses her income to support her parents. 

She will use the loan to buy more hair-dressing equipment to enable her to serve her customers better. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mavis plans to expand the business and employ others to learn from her.

Mavis is the lady in red dress standing by the table and those sitting are her costumers.

loans.use: buy more hair dressing equipment to enable her to serve her customers better.

loans.name: Marietou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois qui abrite a été crée le 18 Septembre 2010. Il est composé de membres qui habitent la même zone et cultivent un bon esprit solidaire entre elles. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, l'emprunteur en vedette Oury est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 fille et 01 garçon. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète une barrique de 100 kgs d'arachide qui lui donnent 30 litres d'huile à revendre. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et de payer ses intérêts.
texts.en:
The banc villageois that houses this group was created on September 18, 2010. It is made up of members who live in the same area and maintain strong group solidarity between themselves. Standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, the lead borrower Oury is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children, 1 girl and 1 boy. 

With the loan she recieved she is buying a cask of 100 kgs of peanuts which will produce 30 liters of oil for resale. The profits generated by the activity will allow her to increase her savings and pay interest.

loans.use: to buy peanuts from which she produces oil to resell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Señora Beatriz, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, trabaja en un local de restaurante en la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente vive a 20 km al oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba,que es cerca al municipio de Quillacollo, la casa donde vive es propia. Ella vive con su esposo y su familia, la cliente no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos. La señora Beatriz necesita un préstamo para la refacción de su vivienda,  la cual ya está muy desgastada por el transcurso del tiempo, la humedad que causo en la parte inferior de las paredes de la vivienda por las lluvias constantes en la ciudad, ya que es la época del tiempo y la vivienda ya necesita hacer el respectivo mantenimiento.
texts.en: Beatriz is a 20-year-old, single woman.  She works in a local restaurant in the city of Cochabamba and lives 20 kilometers to the west of the city of Cochabamba, which is close to the municipality of Quillacollo.  The house she lives in is hers and she lives there with her husband and family.  She does not have children who depend on her income.  She will use the new loan to do some home improvements; it’s quite deteriorated due to the passage of time.  The constant rain in the city this season has caused dampness on the lower part of the house’s walls and she needs to do the required repairs.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a first-time borrower. He is thirty-six years old, married and has a family with four children and two dependents. Gerald has a pre and primary school with two hundred pupils from within his district and neighboring districts. The purpose of the loan is to construct classrooms for his pupils since one classroom cannot house that number. Gerald started this school three years ago and his biggest dream is to eradicate the illiteracy, backwardness, and poverty that have characterized society and caused poverty from the family to national level. In his business, Gerald faces challenges of inadequate classrooms, lack of scholastic materials like uniforms, textbooks, chalk and salaries for paying his staff, including both teaching and non-teaching staff. However with this loan, Gerald is optimistic that he shall be able to construct a simple structure for the classroom block such that his pupils can receive education in a better environment.
