In the photo Gerald with the school children and one of the teachers.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Louniely

texts.en:
Louniely is 38 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Louniely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries such as curls, soft drinks, and coffee to sell. Louniely has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Louniely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as curls, soft drinks, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Frusila

texts.es:
Frusila de 49 años es divorciada y tiene el orgullo de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos hoy ya mayores forjándoles un buen porvenir lleno de principios y valores. Posee una vivienda construida a base de adobe. Resaltando la buena sazón que posee decidió de manera independiente iniciarse en la venta de comida en una feria distrital de su localidad. Lleva 10 años trabajando solo los fines de semana puesto que es un día en que las personas del campo concurren a la ciudad para realizar sus compras semanales y darse algún gustito adicional.
Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que es experta en la preparación de algunos platos típicos de su región como “la puca picante”, “caldo de mote”, entre otros. No obstante el estar parada y en constante movimiento es algo fatigante al finalizar el día, pero con la satisfacción de haber brindado la mejor variedad gastronómica, sus comensales quienes en agradecimiento por la buena atención concurren constantemente a su puesto.
Para seguir trabajando de manera fluida tiene planeado adquirir ingredientes e insumos al por mayor como son el arroz, sacos de papa nativa y otros al por mayor con la finalidad de obtener descuentos y elevar sus ganancias finales.
Tiene el deseo a futuro con su trabajo iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de concreto y ladrillos, pues posee un terreno en una esquina de su barrio y considera que por ser una esquina tendría buena concurrencia para un pequeño negocio de comidas. Este es su primer préstamo, se siente algo tranquila puesto que puede ahora trabajar de manera mas fluida e invertir con mucho entusiasmo. Agradece desde ya a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por la buena acogida.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado en la compra de sacos de arroz, papas nativas y otros para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Frusila, 49, is divorced.  She's proud to have gotten her children ahead, who are now adults, giving them a good future full of principles and values.  She has a house made of adobe.  

Highlighting the good seasoning she has, she decided on her own to get started selling food in a district street fair in her town.  For 10 years she has been working alone on the weekend because it's a day when country people go to the city to do their weekly shopping and give themselves a little extra pleasure.

She's very comfortable in her job because she's an expert in preparing some traditional dishes of her region, including "puca picante" [potatoes with a beet-peanut sauce], "caldo de mote" [a corn soup], and others.  Even so, standing up and constantly moving is somewhat tiring at the end of the day, but with the satisfaction of having given the best variety of food.  Her guests constantly come to her stall in gratitude for her good service.

To continue working smoothly she plans to acquire ingredients and supplies such as rice, sacks of native potatoes, and other products wholesale so she can get discounts and raise her final profits.

In the future she wants to start building her house of concrete and brick because she has land on a corner in her neighborhood and thinks that, because it's on the corner, there would be enough people for a small food business.

She feels at peace because now she can work more smoothly and invest with great enthusiasm.  She's grateful to her communal bank colleagues for their warm welcome.

This is her first loan.  With the 500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll supplement her capital for buying bags of rice, native potatoes, and other supplies to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, native potatoes, and other products

loans.name: Calderon Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras  una de ella es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 4 años . El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, carne de pollo etc., Sonia tiene una mini pulpería también en su domicilio y Jazmín vende productos lácteos.
texts.en: This group consists of three enterprising members, one of whom has owned a convenience store in her home for the past four years. She plans to use the loan to purchase basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, chicken and other items. Sonia also has a small convenience store in her home, and Jazmín sells dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase grains, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is married and has four children. Se is 33 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.

Jovelyn sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

In the future, Jovelyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman. She has two children, ages 10 and 16 years old. She describes herself as a jovial and determined woman. Monicah operates a farm where she sells carrots, coffee, tea, and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a densely-populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. 

Monicah will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy seedlings and manure. Her business goal is to become a large-scale farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and manure

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 40 years old, married, and has been blessed with three children. He owns an education center, and has been in business for five years. He was previously a casual laborer. He is a committed Christian, and since joining Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his education center properly.

Daniel hopes to increase the number of students in his school, and also buy a bus for transporting his students. He is requesting a loan of 84,442 Kenyan Shillings to cement the classrooms and add an additional classroom to the education center.

loans.use: to cement classrooms and add an additional classroom

loans.name: Asmabeth

texts.en:
Asmabeth is 47 years old and lives in Digson Bonifacio. Asmabeth is married with two children. 
Asmabeth works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for eight years. Asmabeth has requested a loan to (Additional Capital). 
Asmabeth has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Asmabeth hopes to expand her fishpond.

loans.use: additional Capital

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy is married  and has four children. Zaldy is 43 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Zaldy is engaged in "buy & sell" to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, he earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work.  He has requested a loan for Php 14,900  to purchase equipment for his quarrying business.

Zaldy has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Zaldy hope to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his quarrying business

loans.name: Maryle Jean

texts.en:
Maryle Jean is widowed with one child. Maryle Jean is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Maryle Jean is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to (Additional Capital). 

Maryle Jean has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Maryle Jean hopes to expand her rice field some day.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is married with no children. He is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Bernard is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan to (Additional Capital). 

Bernard has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Bernard hopes to expand his coconut field some day.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Batholomeo

texts.en:
Batholomeo is a businessman, who owns a grocery store. He has been in business for four years, and he describes his business environment as "busy" and his customers as "very loyal." He is very hard-working. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business properly, and how to save.

He hopes to employ people in his business. Batholomeo needs a loan of 63,585 KES to buy watermelons, pawpaws, avocados, pineapples and bananas, for resale in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, pawpaws, avocados, pineapples and bananas, for resale in his grocery store.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 23 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a motorbike, which he uses for transport services. He also earns an income by supplying milk and bread. He has been in the transport business for twelve years. Faulu Kenya has helped William to improve his business because he has been trained in business management skills. Someday he hopes to expand his business and have a fleet of motorbikes. He requires a loan of 100,265 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Parraxaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria esta casada, tiene 35 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 están estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales, específicamente de pollos de engorde, inicio este negocio cuando se caso, por la necesidad de contar con otros ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, hasta ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a las actividades de jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizara para la compra de pollos de engorde, espera en el futuro tener una granja grande de pollos de engorde. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales y al comercio.
texts.en: zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzsopue8ewyryweiirwer

loans.use: to buy broilers.

loans.name: Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras que se dedica al destace de cerdos, fritos, chicharon, y venta de cerdos en  pie, ese es el caso de Sara que tiene siesa años de dicarse a esa actividad, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo en pie, Yessenia hace repostería y hace queques por encargos, Mildred vende ropa y prendas de oro, María vende nacatamales, fritos con tortilla y moronga.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising members who make a living butchering pigs, in fried food, in fried pork rinds, and selling live pigs.  This is the case of Sara, who has been making a living in this job for several years.

She'll invest the loan in buying live pigs.

Yessenia sells desserts and makes cakes by request.  Mildred sells clothing and gold jewelry.  María sells tamales, fried food with tortillas, and blood sausage.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Melania De Los Angeles' Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es Blanca vende cosméticos Avon, Zelsa, vende comida y nacatamales, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años, es madre soltera con dos hijos menores que le ayudan en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, carne de res, carne de pollo, aceite y cosméticos de la Avon como perfumen, colonias de varón, crema para manos y cuerpos, Jessica vende ropa nueva y Melania vende nacatamales.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three members.  One of them is Blanca, who sells Avon cosmetics and Zelsa products as well as food and tamales, a job she has been doing for four years.  She's a single mother with two younger children who help her in the business.

She's going to invest the loan in buying raw materials such as rice, sugar, beans, beef, chicken, and oil, as well as perfume, men's cologne, hand and body lotion, and other Avon cosmetics.

Jessica sells new clothing and Melania sells tamales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and Avon cosmetics

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 43 years old, is married, and has four school-age children. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living to continue sending their children to school and give them a bright future. 

Charito is employed in a government company, while her husband manages their farmland. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, she and her husband alternately operate their motorcycle transport every weekend to earn extra income. In this regard, Charito is asking for an additional capital of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy gasoline, spare parts, and motorcycle accessories for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Through this financial assistance, Charito and her husband will continuously use their motorcycle to earn additional income. They hope that someday, they will become successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts, and motorcycle accessories for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Atoa

texts.en: Atoa is 35 years old and married with 1 child.  She owns and operates a business printing clothes.  She has years of experience in this line of business. Atoa needs a loan to help her buy paints, plain clothes, designing platform, etc.  She hopes to use her profits to help develop her business and also help her family financially.  She joined SPBD in .

loans.use: paints, fabric material, desiging board, paint brush,.

loans.name: Silyvia's Group

texts.en:
Silyvia's Group comprises six hardworking young women. Silyvia is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Silyvia has been working hard to manage her small business of selling raw food. 

To help expand her business, Silyvia has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes for reselling. This will help Silyvia to generate greater profits and pay for the school fees for her young siblings. Silyvia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Silyvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes for reselling.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married businesswoman who lives in Malindi. For the past 2 years, she has been running a business selling ballast and other building materials commonly referred to as ‘kokoto’. Lilian is the mother of two children, both in school. 

Lilian was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase nails, gravel, timber, etc. Her main challenge is the effect of low seasons since most of the building in town moves with the seasons. Lilian will save the additional income from this loan and use it to provide for her family.

loans.use: To to purchase nails, gravel, timber, etc.

loans.name: Buenaventura's Group

texts.en: Buenaventura, his cousin Cirilo and Marcelo live in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec, Oaxaca. They each provide for a family of six and work in the field cultivating corn. Everyday they must travel  to their workplace, more than an hour away walking distance, where they have a small field house where they take care of their crops. Buenaventura and his eldest son stay over to sleep at this house in the field, where they have no electricity supply. They rely on candles and have no place to charge their cell-phone, their only means of communication for emergencies and to stay in touch with their families during that days they are working. With your loan they will be able to have reliable LED lighting through a solar home system and charge their cell-phones to be able to communicate with their families.

loans.use: Buenaventura and his group buy a solar home system to have reliable light.

loans.name: Otilio's Group

texts.en: Otilio, Antonio and Gregorio live in El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. Their main occupation is in the field where they cultivate corn and beans. Gregorio is 62 years old and provides for a family of 7.  In El Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid in early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which according to Otilio is an average of 3 days per month and 8 days in the rainy season, and in order for his family to work and study, they spend around 10 Mexican Pesos (0.8 USD) on candles every day. During this time, they run out of energy on their cell-phones and have no way of communicating with the nearby centers. With your loan they will have the security of having everyday lighting and energy for their mobile phones, ensuring an adequate place to work, study and spend quality time with their family.

loans.use: Gregorio and his two neighbors each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access for lighting and communication in their homes.

loans.name: Felicita's Group

texts.en:
Felicita has nine children, Donaldo has two and Jenaro has four. They all live in the outskirts of El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec in the State of Oaxaca in Mexico. Eventhough their community has just installed electricity access, their homes are too far away from the electricity posts and they continue to rely on candles during the night to carry out their work activities, studies and domestic chores. 

In Jenaro’s words: “Candles cost us 50 pesos (4 USD) each month and do not allow my children to study well”. Jenaro is 38 years old and has a small space in his home where he works as a carpenter during the day. At 6 p.m. he must stop working because he cannot see well anymore. A loan for a solar home system will not only provide better studying conditions for his children, it will allow him to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work, have more income in times of the year with more demand, and allow him to charge his mobile phone in order to communicate with his clients.

loans.use: Jenaro, Felícita and Donaldo to each purchase a solar system for their homes and carpentry shops to stop relying on candles.

loans.name: Nicolas' Group

texts.en:
Nicolas and Marciano live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In el Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid in early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out.They mention that due to their geographical conditions, sometimes rains can last up to 8 days and there are black-outs during the rains. They believe a solar system will have great value through savings on their energy costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes. Additionally, it can prevent them from running out of battery on their cell-phones and have no way of communicating with the nearby centers. 

Marciano works weaving hammocks which he then sells in the nearby touristic centers. During May-October, the rainy season, it is difficult for him to work the extra hours needed to fit the demand in the summer because of the intermittent energy access. With your loan they will have the security of having everyday light and energy for their mobile phones, ensuring an adequate place to work, study and spend quality time with their family.

loans.use: Nicolas and Marciano each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access.

loans.name: Juan's Group

texts.en:
Juan, Catalino and Alejandra live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 2 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where this picture was taken). Very few of the households in this region have energy access and they rely on ocote wood to light their households. Ocote sends out a lot of smoke and gives out very little light. This does not allow the family of Juan (he has three children) to have an adequate environment for any activities in their household. Ocote is also a health, security and environmental hazard. 

Juan works in the field, mainly with corn and consumes more than 8 pieces of ocote each week for lighting, his community and other households get these by cutting down trees in nearby forests. This mean of lighting is not only hazardous for Juan and his family, it is also dangerous because their households can burn down and it is also beginning to affect the environment due to the high deforestation that this activity is provoking in the surrounding areas. Deforestation also causes population and their homes to be more exposed to natural disasters. Cerro Niño is a community located in hill slopes so with out trees, landslides are more common. This is something that happened during Hurricane Carlota for example. People are left with out communication for weeks when this happens.
He is very excited on acquiring a solar home system to light up and to charge his cellphone for emergencies.

loans.use: Juan, Catalino and Alejandra to stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting and allows each of them to buy a reliable solar home system for quality lighting and cell-phone charging.

location.town: Cerro Niño, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita de 57 años está casada con Zenón. Ella habita un hogar propio al lado de su esposo y de 2 hijos, y se ubica en un distrito de la selva central. Felicita es una mujer que no se cansa. En el calor de su hogar realiza la actividad que le agrada: la preparación de diferentes platos de comida. Siempre ve oportunidades para iniciar un negocio. Cuando sus hijos tuvieron mayores necesidades en el estudio tenía que ingeniárselas para generar más ingresos y no depender solo del sueldo de su esposo. De esa manera empezó preparando dulces tradicionales como las “Chapanas”, que se elaboran a base de harina de yuca y azúcar; pero lo que más vende son los tamales, hechos con maíz molido y relleno de carne; así también, platos de patasca (sopa tradicional concentrada de menudencias de res o carnero), “La base aérea me hace pedidos de platos típicos todos los domingos, no me puedo quejar, me va bien“, comenta orgullosa, pero para ello tiene que despertarse temprano para prepararlos. Ya se acostumbró a la rutina y ya cuenta con clientes fijos, a quienes distribuye los alimentos. 
Éste mes adquirió a crédito una máquina moledora de maíz, con la que prepara con mayor facilidad sus alimentos. Por elo requiere del prestamo para terminar de pagarlo.
texts.en:
Fifty-seven year old Felicita is married to Zenón.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children, in a district of the central forest.  

Felicita is a tireless woman.  In the warmth of her home, she does what she enjoys:  preparing various food dishes.  She always sees opportunities to start a business.  When her children had greater needs for their education, she had to come up with ways to generate more income and not depend only on her husband's salary.  In this way, she began preparing traditional sweets such as "chapanas," that are made with a yucca flour and sugar base.  However, what she sells the most are tamales, made with ground corn and a meat filling, as well as "patasca" (a traditional soup consisting of beef or sheep giblets). 

"The air base places orders with me for typical dishes every Sunday.  I can't complain, it's going well for me," she says proudly.  But for this, she has to wake up early to prepare the dishes.  She is now used to the routine and has regular customers to whom she distributes food.  

This month she got a corn mill on credit, which makes her food preparation easier.  She needs your help to pay for this machine.  This would be her 12th loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her monthly payments.  Her community bank is "Las Heliconias" (The Heliconias), where she is president and enjoys working with responsible partners.  She will invest the money to pay for the electric corn mill to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy an electric corn mill.

loans.name: Butende T/c Group

texts.en: Moses, pictured in a blue shirt and a cap, has dealt in coffee for two years now. He does this business to meet the needs of his family. He would be doing well now, given the fact that coffee is a major cash crop, but his challenges are limited capital and price fluctuations. He hopes with time and with the help of loans his income will improve and his standard of living, as well as that of his family, will improve. His hope is to build a better future for his family. He is hard working and honest. He would like to be trusted so that he can be given more money any time he needs it. (The seventh person, at far right in the photo, is the group chairperson, who is not acquiring a loan this cycle.)

loans.use: To buy organic manure for his coffee plants

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Roma Group

texts.es: Es un grupo que está formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras de éxitos, Ana Jacoba se dedica a vender zapatos, cosméticos de la Avon desde hace cinco años, es casada y tiene un hijo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos, cosméticos variados de la Avon como lociones, perfumen, cremas  para el cuerpo, crema para las manos, etc. Teodora vende cosméticos también de la Avon, Amanda tiene un kiosco estudiantil en un colegio cercano a su domicilio y Ana vende frutas, verduras frescas en su casa.
texts.en: This is a group made up of four successful, enterprising members.  Ana Jacoba has been selling shoes and Avon cosmetics for five years.  She is married and has a son and will use the money from this loan to buy shoes and various Avon cosmetics, such as lotions, perfumes, body creams, hand lotions, etc.  Teodora also sells Avon cosmetics; Amanda has a kiosk at a nearby school; Ana sells fresh fruits and vegetables in her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Tercio Group

texts.es: Nelsy se dedica a vender cosméticos de la Avon desde hace tres años es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos menores, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como perfumen, lociones, cremas para la cara, crema para el cuerpo, lápiz labial, lápiz de cejas, perfumen de mujer etc. Roxana vende ropa variada y Kembeling tiene una pequeña pulpería y hace repostería.
texts.en: Nelsy sell Avon cosmetics and has done so for three years.  She is a single mother and has three children.  She will use the money from this loan to buy Avon cosmetics such as perfumes, lotions, face creams, skin and body creams, lipsticks, eye shadow, perfume, etc.  Roxana sells clothing, and Kembeling has a small grocery store and makes pastries.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: El Cueto Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es Mercedes quien tiene una pulpería con 25 años de experiencia, es una mujer soltera  con un hijo menor de edad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, carne de res, carne de pollo, etc. Luz Adilia tiene un cafetín en su domicilio y Juan Francisco recarga baterías de carros , motos y vende aditivos y lubricantes  de automotor.
texts.en: This group is made up of three members.  Mercedes has had a grocery store for 25 years.  She is single and has a minor son.  She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, milk products, beef, chicken, etc.  Luz Adilia has a café in her home, and Juan Francisco recharges car and motorcycle batteries and sells automotive additives and lubricants.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Lila se dedica a vender nacatamales desde hace cuatro años, es una mujer casada, y ella misma es la que atiende su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, vegetales, maíz, leña etc. Gloría vende también nacatamales  y Rosa tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurs.  Lila sells nacatamales and has done so for four years.  She is married, runs the business herself, and will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients such as pork, chagüite leaves, vegetables, corn, firewood, etc.  Gloria also sells nacatamales, and Rosa has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredents.

loans.name: Almohada Group

texts.es: Es un grupo que está formado por  tres socias emprendedoras como es Nora quien vende pan dulce ambulantes en los diferentes barrios cercano a su domicilio, este crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de pan dulce, pan simple etc. tiene dos de estar con la institución tiene dos hijos y es casada. Daxnia vende tortillas en su casa y Esmeralda vende cosméticos variados.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurs.  Nora sells pastries on foot in different nearby neighborhoods.  She will use the money from this loan to buy pastries, bread, etc.  She has been with the group for two years, is married and has two children.  Daxnia sells tortillas out of her home and Esmeralda sells various types of cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy pastries and bread.

loans.name: Dios Nos Ayude Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Josefa que vende ropa nueva ambulante en un mercado populoso de la capital desde hace 20 años tiene tres hijos de dominio es madre soltera y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva y variada, Dora vende ropa, zapatos, celulares por encargo y Sandra vende cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurs.  Josefa sells new clothing on foot in a popular market in the capital and has been doing so for 20 years.  She has three children and is a single mother and will use the money from this loan to buy new clothing.  Dora sells clothing, shoes, and cell phones on order.  Sandra sells Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: Es un microempresario que se dedica a comercializar ropa usada como sabanas, artículos de electrodomésticos en menor escalas como abanicos, planchas, licuadoras, hornos, desde hace 10 años, es soltero emprendedor. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  pacas de sabanas, y artículos eléctricos como abanicos, licuadoras, planchas etc.
texts.en: He is a small businessman who sells used clothing, sheets, small appliances such as fans, irons, blenders, ovens and has done so for 10 years.  He will use the money from this loan to buy packs of sheets and small appliances.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Karezi

texts.en:
Karezi is a married father of two children who lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He owns a carpentry shop, which he started ten years ago through savings from casual jobs. He has continued to supply finished wood products to customers in his local community. 

Karezi was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase timber, a smoothing plane and other machines. His main challenge is bad debts and the high cost of transportation. His sights are set on owning a large store or factory in the future that deals in woodwork, and on owning other carpentry shops.

Karezi believes the loan will help him meet his clients’ demands on time. He will use the extra income obtained through the loan to invest in his family's future needs and also pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase timber, a smoothing plane and other machines for woodwork.

loans.name: Tema Group

texts.en:
Tema is a group of 20 farmers in Busia District.  The group has 14 women and 6 men. The group is represented by Gabriel, who is standing on the far right of the photo. Farming inputs, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize and sorghum, will be delivered to him on credit.

Gabriel is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited about the 2013 Long Rains season.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to use increased profits to send his children to school.

Last year, Gabriel harvested 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. He is excited to improve his harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He plans to spend the money that he earns from his next harvest on sending his children to school and perhaps investing in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Gabriel’s group members will take input loans for  ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 10 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Alfonso's Group

texts.en:
Gilberto, Alfonso and Santiago live in Santa Lucia Teotepec, a small and secluded commercial center in the Chatina Region in Oaxaca. Even though they have grid electricity access, the geographical conditions of the region and the constant rains limit their energy access due to constant blackouts. In the words of Gilberto “when it rains, it takes up to 8 days for the electricity to come back”. 

Gilberto owns a small store in the center of Santa Lucia, where he gives the town access to the only phone service, groceries, transportation to other towns, radio communication and basic products for subsistence needs. “When there is a blackout, people do not come to my store during the night, making me lose around 300 pesos (25 USD) per day of income to maintain my family and business running”. Additionally, the population cannot communicate to other towns in case of emergencies. With your loan, Gilberto will be able to have reliable lighting to offer these services to his customers, and be able to use a solar home system in case of emergencies to use the radio system when needed.

loans.use: Gilberto, Alfonso and Santiago each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and business.

location.town: Santa Lucia Teotepec, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Demetrio's Group

texts.en:
Demetrio, Ceferino and their cousins wife Ambrosia all live in the outskirts of Santa Lucía Teotepec in the Chatina Region of Oaxaca in Mexico. In this region, must of the men travel long distances to take care of their crops, so they do not come back home for many nights in a row, leaving women and children alone.

Demetrio and his family usually stay over to sleep at their home near their crop, where they have no electricity supply. They rely on candles to work early in the morning processing the sugar cane into panela. Panela is unrefined whole cane or cube of sugar, which is basically a solid piece of glucose and fructose obtained from the boiling and evaporation of sugarcane juice. With your loan they will be able to have reliable LED lighting through a solar home system and charge their mobile phones for emergencies or to stay in touch with their families back home.

loans.use: Demetrio and his two neighbors each purchase a solar system to have reliable energy access for their workplace.

location.town: Santa Lucia Teotepec, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Rodolfo's Group

texts.en:
Rodolfo and Felix live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In El Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which they mention can last up to 8 days whenever it rains due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value through savings on their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes. 

Both Rodolfo and Felix have made a great effort to support their children continuing school; Rodolfo has two kids, one in preschool and one in elementary school, and Felix has four: two in elementary, one in a remote secondary school and one studying a technical career in a town nearby, but still living with his parents. When there is a several days blackout, all of Rodolfo´s and Felix children have to study in their homes by the lights of candles. A loan for a solar home system will not only provide better studying conditions for his children, it will allow both families to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work to continue supporting their children so they don't have to leave school to support family income.

loans.use: Rodolfo and Felix each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and support their children education

loans.name: Luis' Group

texts.en:
Miguel and his both sons Luis and Marcos families live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In El Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which they mention can last up to 8 days whenever it rains due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value through savings on their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes. 

All of the Rojas families work in the field, cultivating beans and corn. They work all together in faraway farms, and they sometimes have to leave their families several days in a row. When this happens, the women and the children of the family are left alone, and when the light are out, they feel they are more vulnerable.  A loan for a solar home system will not only improve security conditions for all their families, it will allow Rojas families to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work and for their children to study.

loans.use: Rojas families each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and provide for their families better security conditions

loans.name: Ignacio's Group

texts.en: Ignacio, Justino ana Valentin live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 3 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where this picture was taken). All of the 30+ households in this community depend on ocote pine for lighting. Ocote sends out a lot of smoke and gives out very little light. This causes the family of Ignacio with his four children to have an inadequate environment for family, education and other activities in their home, besides being a health, security and environmental hazard. Ignacio works in the field, mainly with corn, coffee, sugar cane and beans and consumes more than 12 pieces of ocote each week for lighting. His community and other households get these by cutting down trees in nearby forests, and depend exclusively on daylight for income-generating activities. He is very excited on acquiring a solar home system to have additional working hours for him and his kids to study, and commented on the importance of reducing the smoke caused by his current lighting sources.

loans.use: Ignacio, Justino ana Valentin to buy a reliable solar home system and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

location.town: Cerro Cuero, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Abi Noemí's Group

texts.en: Abi and Gerenia and their families live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In el Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out, which they mention can last up to 8 days during whenever it rains due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value through saving on their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes when there are blackouts. Both women contribute to their families income by producing clay products that they sell in nearby tourist spots and in nearby commerce centers. They belong to a cooperative of women that is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras de Tiltepec” (Working Woman from Tiltepec) and they participate in different exhibits and that is starting to sell their products to different Foundations and bigger crafts shops.  A loan for a solar home system will allow this working women to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work and generate higher incomes for their families.

loans.use: Abi and Gerenia each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and gain 4 hours more to produce clay products

loans.name: Benito's Group

texts.en:
Benito, Dagoberto and Policarpio live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 3 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where this picture was taken). All of the 30+ households in this community are too far away from the grid to get electric service and depend on ocote pine for lighting and activities. Ocote sends out polluting smoke and provides poor lighting, besides being a health, security and environmental hazard due to smoke emissions and deforestation. 

Dagoberto is 58 years old and his wife is very excited on acquiring a solar home system and providing their three children with an inadequate environment for studying in their home. Dagoberto works in the field, mainly with sugar cane. He processes the sugar cane by grinding it and sells the liquid sugar in the near commercial center. He processes it with a yoke and cattle, and Dagoberto mentioned the best time to do this is 3-5 a.m. because working the cattle during the day causes exhaustion in the animals due to the heat. It is very common to have to work during the night in the summer and with poor lighting that ocote pine gives, many community members have had accidents. He is very excited on acquiring a solar home system to be able to work with quality lighting to process the sugar cane, and his wife believes it will improve conditions for their kids to study, and commented on the importance of reducing the smoke caused by his current lighting sources.

loans.use: Benito, Dagoberto and Policarpio acquire a solar home system to increase their working hours and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

location.town: Cerro Cuero, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Valentín's Group

texts.en: Ramiro, Valentín and Justina live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 2 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where the picture was taken). The households in this region do not have energy access and they rely on ocote wood (a type of wood with a lot of resin that burns easily but causes lots of hazardous fumes)  to light their households. This does not allow these families to have an adequate environment for any activities in their household, besides being a health, safety and environmental hazard. Justina for example, consumes more than 8 pieces of ocote each week for lighting. Once a week she has to go to the woods to cut down trees to collect ocote for cooking and lighting, and she dedicates up to six hours in this activity, including carrying the heavy load back home. She is very excited on acquiring a solar home system and not having to inhale the smoke caused by her current lighting sources.

loans.use: Ramiro, Valentín and Justina to buy a reliable solar home system and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

location.town: Cerro Niño, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Guadalupe's Group

texts.en:
Guadalupe, Pablo and Felix live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 3 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where this picture was taken). They work together processing sugar cane. All of the 30+ households in this community are not in the grid extension possibilities for the Federal Electricity Commission and depend on ocote pine for lighting and productive activities. Ocote provides poor lighting and is a health, security and environmental hazard. 

Guadalupe is 42 years old and lives with his wife and six children, who have constant health problems due to indoor air pollution and do not have adequate conditions to study during the night. Guadalupe cultivates and processes sugar cane, and during the harvest period he grinds it with a yoke and cattle and sells it in the near commercial center. Due to the intense summer heat, in order to prevent the cattle from being fatigued, Guadalupe mentioned it is very common to have to start work at 2 a.m. under the poor lighting that ocote pine gives, and many community members have had accidents. Additionally, his wife sells tortillas and has to wake up at 5 a.m. to cook, also under the poor lighting from the ocote pine. They are very enthusiastic on acquiring a solar home system to be able to work with quality lighting. They also believe it will improve conditions for their kids to study and will extend the time and quality of their working hours to have better income opportunities.

loans.use: Guadalupe, Pablo and Felix purchase a solar home system to increase their working conditions when processing sugar cane and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

location.town: Cerro Cuero, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Macario's Group

texts.en:
Macario his wife Catalina and his daughter in law Lidia live in Oaxaca, México in a small community called El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec. In el Paraíso, they just got access to the electric grid early 2012, however the service is extremely unreliable. They continue to rely on candles when the lights go out. They mention blackouts can last up to 8 days during the rainy season due to their geographical conditions. They believe a solar system will have great value, providing savings in their electricity costs and will eliminate the need for the use of candles in their homes when there are blackouts. 

Both women contribute to their families income and belong to a cooperative of women that is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras de Tiltepec” (Working Woman from Tiltepec). This cooperative participates in different exhibitions and is helping women to sell their products to different foundations and bigger crafts shops.  

Catalina is teaching her daughter-in-law Lidia to work with clay, and Macario is in charge of selling the products because Catalina only speaks Chatino and can't communicate with clients in Spanish. A loan for a solar home system will allow these working women to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work and generate higher incomes for their families.

loans.use: Macario, Catalina and Lidia each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and gain 4 hours more to produce clay products

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишеру 28 лет. Он родился в семье фермера и всегда мечтал стать известным бизнесменом. Он женат на доброй женщине, которая является хорошей домохозяйкой. Алишер имеет 2 детей. Старшему 3 года, а младшему 1,5 года. 

Алишер очень трудолюбивый человек. Он более 6 лет занимается услугой такси. Благодаря хорошему сервису он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Его клиенты довольны его работой. Алишер использует полученный доход от бизнеса для покупки всех нужных средства для проживания. 

Он хочет провести церемонию обрезания своего сына, но не имеет сбережения для этого. Процесс проведения такого церемония требует массу денег, так как нужно проводить данное церемоние по всем обычаям. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения церемония. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Alisher is 28 years old. He was born in a farmer's family and has always dreamed of becoming a known businessman. Alisher is married to a kind woman, who takes good care of their household. They have 2 children who are 3 and 1.5 years old.

Alisher is a very hard-working person. For over 6 years, he has been offering taxi services. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has a number of regular clients who are happy with his work. Alisher uses his business income to pay for his family's living expenses.

Alisher would like to hold a circumcision ceremony for his son, but does not have sufficient savings. This event requires a substantial amount of money, since the ceremony must be carried out in full accordance with traditions. Alisher is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni for this ceremony. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a ceremony

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo lives in Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of eight children, mostly grown up; only two are in school. He owns an animal-sales business, which he has been operating for one year. In this shop, Charo trades in buying and selling of the same animals. He is also employed as a guard in a school.

He learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is bad debts and insufficient funds.

Charo is applying for a loan of 10,700 KES to buy other indigenous animals. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy other indigenous animals.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Shalom” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, comerciantes, librería, bazar, venta de adornos navideños, venta de ropa, venta de juguetes, venta de longanizas, venta de empanadas, servicios entre otros, Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Coronel.
Edith, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha  a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color negro, usa cartera de color café claro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y comestibles varios desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo, algunas veces le ayuda sus hijos, habilito un espacio en su casa para su negocio y atender a su gran numero de clientela. Ofrece frutas y verduras frescas, además bebida, cecinas y helados.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en ferias libres donde encuentra verduras y frutas frescas  y los demás productos a proveedores de marcas importantes de cecinas y bebidas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará frutas y verduras.
Una de las metas de Edith es tener su negocio más grande y agregar maquinas para los productos congelados, así generar mayores ingresos para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Edith vive junto a sus tres hijos de 20, 16 y 5 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral  agrandar su negocio y a nivel familiar darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Shalom and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who make a living in various businesses, including market stalls, merchants, bookstore, hardware store, Christmas decoration sales, clothing sales, toy sales, sausage sales, empanada sales, and services, all in the city of Coronel.

Edith is a member of the communal bank group.  In the photograph she's seated in the first seat on the right in the first row.  She's wearing a black jacket and a light brown purse; she wears her dark-brown hair loose.

She has made a living for a year selling fruits, vegetables, and food.  She says she works from Monday through Sunday.  Sometimes her children help her.  She fixed up a space in her house for her business and she waits on a large number of customers.  She sells fresh fruits and vegetables as well as beverages, cured meat, and ice cream.

She buys the merchandise she needs in street markets where she finds fresh fruits and vegetables.  She buys the rest of the products from distributors of major brands of cured meat and beverages, at a low cost so it's economical.

With the loan she'll buy fruits and vegetables.

One of Edith's goals is to expand her business and add machines for frozen products to generate more income and aim for a better quality of life.

Edith lives with her three children, ages 20, 16, and 5.  Her dream for work is to expand her business and her dream for her family is to give her children the best.

She's very happy about and grateful for this opportunity from Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  With regard to her communal bank group, she says they have very good communication.  Also, the trainings have helped her learn new sales and accounting strategies.

Coronel is a community in the south of Chile, near the city of Concepción in the Bíobío region.  Its economy is based on services, lumber, and agriculture.  It also has an important coal mining tradition, which is no longer done but from which remains the Chiflón Puchoco mine, now a mining museum.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Copaboka 1 Group

texts.fr:
Madame Véronique, membre du groupe COPABOKA 1, âgé de 54 ans, cultivatrice du riz,  a 10 enfants dont le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. 8 de ses enfants vont à l'école et n'a aucune autre personne en sa charge. Véronique a 3 ans de l'école familiale.
Elle est devenue cliente de l'ACB en 2011 est le cycle actuel est le deuxième. Le crédit sollicité sera utilisé pour acheter les engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle va utiliser la stratégie d’utiliser la semence sélectionnée pour accroitre son activité agricole. Avec le profit, elle va éduquer et faire soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Véronique, a member of the "Capoboka 1" group, is 54 years old and a rice farmer. She has 10 children, the eldest of whom is 30 and the youngest, 8. 8 of her children go to school and she is responsible for no other people. Véronique has 3 years of education at a family school.

She became a customer of ACB in 2011 and is currently on her second loan cycle. The loan being requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers. Her strategy will be to use selected seeds in order to expand her farming business. She will use the profits for her children's education and health care.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Joffre Antonio

texts.es:
Joffre Antonio   tiene 42 años de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Joffre Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos orgánicos, químico. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar buena semillas.

Las compras  y las ventas lo harán en Ventanas. El sueño es poder darles el estudio a los hijos y comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Joffre Antonio is 42 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

He is a member of VRC El RECREO, which is located in San Vicente, Las Lomas precinct. Belonging to Ventanas canton, the members of this community bank work in farming and raising livestock.

Joffre Antonio works as a farmer, growing corn, beans and rice. He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, and organic and chemical fertilizers. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy good seeds. 

He will make his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

Joffre Antonio's dream is to be able to provide his children with an education, and buy land to continue planting. In his free time he enjoys playing sport.

loans.use: to buy seeds, and organic and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Solano Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios una de ellas es Hortensia quien tiene 7 años de echar tortilla, es acompañada y  tiene dos hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cal, leña, cerdo  para hacer nacatamales para la temporada navideña, Silvana vende nacatamales y venta de tortillas en su domicilio y Ulises vende comida en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group has three members, one of whom is Hortensia.  Hortensia has been making tortillas for seven years.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She will invest her loan in buying corn, lime, firewood and pork for making tamales for the Christmas season.

Silvana sells tamales and tortillas from home and Ulises also sells food from home.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime and pork for making tamales

loans.name: Estoy Confiando Group

texts.es: Socios formados por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Kenia su negocio es fabricar sillas de mimbres actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace 10 años, inicio vendiendo cosméticos, sus hijos que son cuatro trabajan con ella en la fabricación de las sillas de mimbres. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como el mimbre para fábrica de sillas, Zelania vende nacatamales y Silvia vende ropa usada.
texts.en:
This group has three entrepreneurial members, one of whom is Kenia.  Kenia's business is making wicker chairs.  She has been in this business for 10 years, having originally started out selling cosmetics.  Kenia has four children who work with her making chairs.  She will invest this loan in buying raw materials such as wicker for making chairs.

Zelania sells tamales and Silvia sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wicker for making chairs

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es: Socias formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Rita que se dedica a vender verduras,como tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, yuca,  perecederos ambulantes desde hace 8 años, inicio vendiendo fritanga en su domicilio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras y perecederos, Juana vende repuestos para motos, Julia vende cereales y Araceli también vende cereales.
texts.en:
This group has four entrepreneurial members, one of whom is Rita.  Rita's business is selling vegetables such as tomatoes, sweet peppers, onions, cassava and other perishable food products.  She has been selling these products as an itinerant street vendor for eight years, having initially started out in business selling fried food from her home.  She will invest this loan in buying vegetables and perishable food products.

Juana sells motorcycle spare parts, Julia sells cereals and Araceli also sells cereals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, sweet peppers, cassava, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Jocotal Group

texts.es: María Lucrecia es miembro del grupo formado por tres socias tiene una pulpería desde hace cinco años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón de lavar, jabón de baño, carne de res, carne de pollo etc. Lila vende pan ambulante y Juana tiene una pulpería y venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
María Lucrecia is a member of this three person group. She has had a grocery store for five years.
The loan will be used to buy basics, like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, beef, chicken, etc.

Lila is a street vendor of bread and Juana has a general store and sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy basics, such as grains, rice, beans, sugar, soap, detergent, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: El Taller Del Maestro Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres  socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Yessenia vende cosméticos de la Avon desde hace un año, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como perfumen, crema para las manos, crema para el cuerpo, lociones, bodis etc.,  Blanca vende zapatos y Saida vende dulces y turrones de trigo con miel de atados de dulce.
texts.en: This group has 3 enterprising members.  One of these is Yessenia, who has had a business selling Avon brand cosmetics for a year.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of cosmetics such as: perfumes, hand creams, body lotions, lotions, body sprays, etc.  Blanca sells shoes, and Saida sells sweets and nougats made with wheat and honey, and with sweet sugar cane.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, hand creams, body lotions, lotions, body sprays, etc.

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Ileana quien tiene un taller de costura en su casa desde hace 2 años, inicio con una pequeña pulpería y le fue mejor como costurera que cambio actividad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como conos de hilos, gruesas de botones, adornos, encajes, telas, entre telas etc. Vilgen tiene una venta de fritanga en su casa y Yahosca tiene una pulpería en su casa también.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Ileana; she has a sewing workshop in her home, a business that she started 2 years ago. She began with a small grocery store but has done better in her shop and decided to focus on the sewing business. The loan will be used to buy raw materials like thread spools, different types of buttons, decorations, lace, fabrics, backing fabric, etc. Vilgen sells fried fast-food in her home and Yahosca has a small grocery store in her home.

loans.use: buy raw materials like thread spools, different types of buttons, decorations, lace, fabrics, backing fabric, etc.

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es: Santiago es un microempresario de éxito desde hace 8 años vende pollo en el mercado de Masaya, es un hombre casado con dos hijos y además se dedica a la agricultura ya que tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pollo por la temporada navideña.
texts.en: Santiago is a successful micro businessman who has been selling chicken in the Masaya market for 8 years.  He’s a married man with two children and he also works in agriculture since he has a small parcel he grows on.  He will use the loan to buy chicken for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy chickens for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa su negocio es destace de cerdo y venta de nacatamales  desde hace 6 años es casada y tiene una hija le ayuda en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo en pie para el destace, Fabiola vende ropa y zapatos y Mariela vende ropa y zapatos.
texts.en: This is a group of three enterprising women. One of them is Rosa. For the past six years she has been in the business of slaughtering pigs and selling nacatamales. She is married and has a daughter who helps her in the business. She will use this loan to buy a live pig to slaughter. Fabiola and Mariela sell clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to invest money into the purchase of a live pig to slaughter.

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Erica que vende cosméticos de la Avon desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como bodis, crema para el cuerpo, crema para las manos, lociones, perfumen etc. Jessica vende chinelas, Digna vende comida y Maricela vende sandalias de cueros hechas en Masaya.
texts.en: This group is made up of four members. One of them is Erica; she has sold Avon makeup for some 3 years. The loan will be used to buy Avon makeup like body spray, body lotion, hand cream, lotions, perfumes, etc. Jessica sells slippers, Digna sells food and Maricela sells leather sandals made in Masaya.

loans.use: buy Avon makeup like body lotion, hand cream, lotions, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Las Cuatros Fantasticas Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gema quien vende ropa usada, ropa nueva y variada y cosméticos actividad que hace desde hace tres años, es casada con un hijo menor, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada, ropa nueva. Javiera vende mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos, y Mercedes vende prendas de plata y ropa.
texts.en: This communal bank is comprised of three business-owning members. One of them is Gema, who sells used garments, various types of new garments and cosmetics. She has been in this line of work for three years. She's married and has an underage son. She'll use the loan to purchase new and used clothing. Javiera sells general merchandise such as garments and shoes, and Mercedes sells silver costume jewelry and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase new and used clothing.

loans.name: Madoma Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es Luz Marina quien vende comida todos los días en su casa, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 11 años, es casadas tiene dos hijos, y su esposo quien le ayuda en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras etc. Mayra es diseñadora de trajes nocturnos y Hiondra tiene una tienda de variedades.
texts.en:
This group is formed of three micro-entrepreneurial members.  One of the women is Luz Marina, who sells food every day in her house.  She has been doing this for eleven years.  She is married and has two children, and her husband is the one who helps with her business.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials, like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, etc.  

Mayra is a designer of evening suits and costumes, and Hiondra has a variety store.

loans.use: to buy grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: 12 De Octubre Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro socias emprendedora una de ellas es Ileana  que vende zapatos, cosméticos y ropa usada hace 6 años. Inicio vendiendo ropa usada y con los márgenes de ganancia fue diversificando sus productos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos de la Avon etc. Noelia vende sandalias, Luisa Amanda vende zapatos, ropa nueva y electrodomésticos en menor escala y Ana vende ropa y sandalias.
texts.en: This communal bank is made up of four entrepreneurial members.  One of them is Ileana.  She has been selling shoes, cosmetics and second-hand clothing for six years.  She started out selling second-hand clothing and with her profit margin, she diversified her products.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing, shoes and Avon products etc.  Among the other members of the communal bank, Noelia sells sandals, Luisa Amanda sells shoes, new clothing and, to a lesser degree, electrical appliances, and Ana sells clothing and sandals.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes and Avon products, such as perfume, hand lotion, body lotion, hair cream, cologne etc.

loans.name: Las Carmelitas Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es Catalina vende frutas y verduras ambulante desde hace 5 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras y frutas, Evarista vende gaseosas, hielo, helados etc. y Ana vende ropa nueva.
texts.en: This group has three members. One of them is Catalina. For the past five years she has been a street vendor, selling fruit and vegetables. She will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables. Evarista sells soda pop, ice and ice cream etc.  Ana sells unused clothing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions, sweet pepper and fruits like oranges, pineapples and papaya etc.

loans.name: Pastora Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es María  quien vende tortillas, cuajadas, gaseosa, café negro, en la terminal de buses cercano a su casa. Ella inicio vendiendo verduras y frutas tiene 8 años de tener el negocio y el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, cuajaditas, gaseosas, café etc.  Elieska vende zapatos usados y Celia vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos.
texts.en: This group is made up of three members. One of them is María she sells tortillas, cheese (made from milk curd), sodas, and black coffee in the bus terminal close to her home. She began her business selling vegetables and fruits; she has had her business for over 8 years. The loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, cheese, refreshments, coffee, etc. Elieska sells used shoes and Celia sells tortillas and cooked beans.

loans.use: el credito lo invertira en la compra de maiz, leña, cuajaditas, gaseosas, cafe etc

loans.name: Celestial Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ella es ESvetlana que se dedica a  comercializar venta de ropa y prendas de oro desde hace 1 año. Inicio con una pulpería luego con las ganancias fue diversificando su actividad comercial con los nuevos productos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y prendas de plata, Ligia comercializa prendas de plata y Daysi vende ropa usada.
texts.en: This group consists of 3 successful entrepreneurs.  One of the members is Esvetlana who has been selling clothes for one year.  She started with a small store and later with the earnings she was able to diversify her commercial activity with new products.  She will invest this loan in buying new clothes and silver ornaments to sell.  Ligia sells silver ornaments as well and Daysi sells used clothing.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and silver ornaments to sell

loans.name: Ls Esmeralda Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Lidia vende lotería y raspaditas desde hace 25 años que se dedica a la comercializar, es una mujer casada con dos hijos mayores que le apoyan en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de billetes de loterías y raspaditas, Mercedes tiene una panadería en su domicilio, Raquel  vende lotería y fritanga en su domicilio.
texts.en: This supportive group is made up of three enterprising and successful members. One of them is Lidia. She has sold lottery and scratch off tickets for 25 years. She is a married woman with two grown children who help in the business. She will invest the loan in buying lottery and scratch off tickets.  Mercedes has a bread bakery in her house and Raquel sells lottery tickets and fritanga in her house.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets and scratch -offs

loans.name: La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está formado por seis socias emprendedoras tal es el caso de Emma vende tortilla, cuajaditas, frijoles cocidos cabeza de chancho en su domicilio desde hace dos años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cabezas de cerdos, maíz, leña, cal, cuajaditas, frijoles crudos para su negocio, Sandra vende frutas, Meyling vende frutas también, Emma Maricela vende cosméticos, Rosa Angélica vende verduras, piñas y ropa variada, Angélica vende nacatamales ambulante.
texts.en:
This communal bank has six enterprising members.  Emma is one of them.  She’s been selling tortillas, milk curd, cooked beans and pig’s head at home for two years.  She will use the loan to buy pig heads, corn, firewood, lime powder and raw beans for her business.

Sandra sells fruit, Meyling sells fruit too, Emma Maricela sells cosmetics, Rosa Angélica sells vegetables, pineapples and assorted clothes and Angélica sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] from place to place.

loans.use: to buy pig heads, corn, firewood, lime powder, milk curd and raw beans.

loans.name: Puro Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la Oriflame desde hace dos años ese es el caso de Francisca, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de oriflame, es una mujer casada, con tres hijos que le ayudan a colocar el producto ya que los vende al crédito, Emilce vende cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat y María de los Angeles hace repostería como queque, vende gaseosa en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three enterprising members.  Francisca has sold Oriflame brand cosmetics for the last two years.  She will use the loan to buy Oriflame cosmetics.  She’s married with three children who help her sell her products since she sells on credit.

Emilce sells Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics, María de los Ángeles makes pastries like cakes and sells soft-drinks at home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Luz Eterna Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ellas es Fátima que se dedica a vender ropa, cosméticos como perfume, lociones, cremas para cuerpos, crema para manos, maquillajes etc. Esta actividad tiene 8 años , es casada, y tiene dos hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y cosméticos como perfume, colonias de varón, crema para manos y cremas para cuerpos, maquillajes etc.
texts.en: Three members make up this group.  One of them is Fátima who sells clothes and cosmetics like perfume, lotion, body creams, hand cream, make-up, etc.  She’s been in this business for 8 years.  She’s married and has two children.   She will use the loan to buy clothes and cosmetics like perfume, men’s cologne, hand and body cream, make-up, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es: Socia microempresaria emprendedora tiene una pulpería en su casa hace cinco años, ella inició su negocio vendiendo cosméticos y con las ganancias fue comprando mercadería de pulpería hasta que llego alcanzar un inventario de productos considerables hasta hoy, es casada y tiene un hijo menor de cuidado. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, va comprar ropa, zapatos por la temporada navideña y productos de ferretería que sus clientes le están demandando.
texts.en: This enterprising micro businesswoman has had a home-based grocery store for five years.  She started the business selling cosmetics and used profits to start buying grocery store stock merchandise until now that she has a considerable inventory of products.  She’s married and has a minor son in her care.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains like rice and beans, sugar, oil and will also buy clothes and shoes for the Christmas season as well as hardware items her customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy grains, oil, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Cenia Delfina

texts.es: La socia tiene 32 años de edad casada, con tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa variada con 12 años de experiencias, anteriormente se dedicaba al estilismo y fue mezclando ambas actividades  que le fue bien en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa variado y cosméticos variados como perfumen, colonias, crema para manos, cremas para cuerpos, delineadores, lápiz labial etc.
texts.en:
The borrower is 32 years old, married, with three children. She sells cosmetics and a variety of clothing and has 12 years of experience. Previously a hair stylist, she began to combine both activities, and things went well in the business. 

She will use loan to buy a variety of clothing, as well as a variety of cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, hand creams, body creams, eyeliners, lipstick, etc.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing, as well as cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, hand creams, body creams, eyeliners, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en:
Mchekwisha is from Mombasa, Kenya. She resides in the rural area of Tiribe, a town on the south coast of Kenya. She's a businesswoman and the owner of a retail shop. She has been doing this work for more than three years and she has become very well known among the customers who go there.

Mchekwisha is a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She opens her shop at 7:00 am and closes as late as 9:00 pm.

She's requesting this loan to be able to increase her stock. She will buy noodles, snacks, soft drinks, flour, tissue papers and instant products.

loans.use: to buy noodles, snacks, soft drinks, flour, tissue papers and instant products.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora dinámica, además de ser alegre y amable. Es casada con Américo  quien se dedica al transporte de carga y es padre de sus 3 hijos quienes 2  ya son independientes.  Vive en compañía de último hijo Arney de 32 años de edad instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Olga es la crianza de pollos de granja, para eso cuenta con un pequeño galpón con capacidad máxima de 150 pollos, que está instalado en el segundo piso de su casa, donde los cría y los vende en el mercado, logrando vender toda su producción. También vende comidas rápidas por las noches en el frontis de su casa.  .
Iniciándose con un capital propio hace 1 año,  fruto de sus ahorros, contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la limpieza y alimentación de los pollos en sus ratos libres.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene éste producto, por ser de consumo masivo en la alimentación diaria de la población.
Le gusta su actividad al poder contar con un ingreso económico extra, para los gastos que se presentaran en el hogar,  también el sentirse una mujer productiva y distraerse. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que algunas veces se le murieron parte su producción debido a la peste, ocasionándole pérdidas, logrando reiniciar gracias al apoyo de MFP, por eso tiene planes de continuar con actividad y realizar algunos arreglos y  construir un pequeño galpón en el primer piso de su casa, con una capacidad de 200 pollos. Con el monto que solicita, lo invertirá en el arreglo de la infraestructura de su galpón, comprando calaminas  para renovar el techado, viruta para el piso los pollos bebes para empezar con una nueva producción de por lo menos 150 pollos.
texts.en:
Fifty-five year old Olga is a dynamic, hardworking woman, who is also cheerful and friendly.  She is married to Américo, who makes his living transporting goods and is father to their three children, two of whom are already independent.  She lives comfortably with her youngest son Arney, who is 32 years old, in their own home.
